29 #ifndef NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
30 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
31 
32 #include <algorithm> // all_of, copy, fill, find, for_each, none_of, remove, reverse, transform
33 #include <array> // array
34 #include <cassert> // assert
35 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or
36 #include <clocale> // lconv, localeconv
37 #include <cmath> // isfinite, labs, ldexp, signbit
38 #include <cstddef> // nullptr_t, ptrdiff_t, size_t
39 #include <cstdint> // int64_t, uint64_t
40 #include <cstdlib> // abort, strtod, strtof, strtold, strtoul, strtoll, strtoull
41 #include <cstring> // memcpy, strlen
42 #include <forward_list> // forward_list
43 #include <functional> // function, hash, less
44 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
45 #include <iomanip> // hex
46 #include <iostream> // istream, ostream
47 #include <iterator> // advance, begin, back_inserter, bidirectional_iterator_tag, distance, end, inserter, iterator, iterator_traits, next, random_access_iterator_tag, reverse_iterator
48 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
49 #include <locale> // locale
50 #include <map> // map
51 #include <memory> // addressof, allocator, allocator_traits, unique_ptr
52 #include <numeric> // accumulate
53 #include <sstream> // stringstream
54 #include <string> // getline, stoi, string, to_string
55 #include <type_traits> // add_pointer, conditional, decay, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_arithmetic, is_base_of, is_const, is_constructible, is_convertible, is_default_constructible, is_enum, is_floating_point, is_integral, is_nothrow_move_assignable, is_nothrow_move_constructible, is_pointer, is_reference, is_same, is_scalar, is_signed, remove_const, remove_cv, remove_pointer, remove_reference, true_type, underlying_type
56 #include <utility> // declval, forward, make_pair, move, pair, swap
57 #include <vector> // vector
58 
59 // exclude unsupported compilers
60 #if defined(__clang__)
61 #if(__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
62 #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
63 #endif
64 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
65 #if(__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40900
66 #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
67 #endif
68 #endif
69 
70 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
71 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
72 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
73 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
74 #endif
75 
76 // disable documentation warnings on clang
77 #if defined(__clang__)
78 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
79 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
80 #endif
81 
82 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
83 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
84 #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
85 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
86 #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
87 #else
88 #define JSON_DEPRECATED
89 #endif
90 
91 // allow to disable exceptions
92 #if(defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && not defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
93 #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
94 #define JSON_TRY try
95 #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
96 #else
97 #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
98 #define JSON_TRY if(true)
99 #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
100 #endif
101 
102 // manual branch prediction
103 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
104 #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
105 #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
106 #else
107 #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
108 #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
109 #endif
110 
111 namespace possumwood {
112 
113 namespace io {
114 
123 namespace detail {
125 // exceptions //
127 
140 class exception : public std::exception {
141  public:
143  virtual const char* what() const noexcept override {
144  return m.what();
145  }
146 
148  const int id;
149 
150  protected:
151  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg) : id(id_), m(what_arg) {
152  }
153 
154  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id) {
155  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id) + "] ";
156  }
157 
158  private:
160  std::runtime_error m;
161 };
162 
210 class parse_error : public exception {
211  public:
220  static parse_error create(int id, size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg) {
221  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id) + "parse error" +
222  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") + ": " + what_arg;
223  return parse_error(id, byte_, w.c_str());
224  }
225 
236  const size_t byte;
237 
238  private:
239  parse_error(int id_, size_t byte_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_) {
240  }
241 };
242 
282 class invalid_iterator : public exception {
283  public:
284  static invalid_iterator create(int id, const std::string& what_arg) {
285  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id) + what_arg;
286  return invalid_iterator(id, w.c_str());
287  }
288 
289  private:
290  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {
291  }
292 };
293 
327 class type_error : public exception {
328  public:
329  static type_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg) {
330  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id) + what_arg;
331  return type_error(id, w.c_str());
332  }
333 
334  private:
335  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {
336  }
337 };
338 
357 class out_of_range : public exception {
358  public:
359  static out_of_range create(int id, const std::string& what_arg) {
360  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id) + what_arg;
361  return out_of_range(id, w.c_str());
362  }
363 
364  private:
365  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {
366  }
367 };
368 
381 class other_error : public exception {
382  public:
383  static other_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg) {
384  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id) + what_arg;
385  return other_error(id, w.c_str());
386  }
387 
388  private:
389  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {
390  }
391 };
392 
394 // JSON type enumeration //
396 
421 enum class value_t : uint8_t {
422  null,
423  object,
424  array,
425  string,
426  boolean,
427  number_integer,
428  number_unsigned,
429  number_float,
430  discarded
431 };
432 
442 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept {
443  static constexpr std::array<uint8_t, 8> order = {{
444  0, // null
445  3, // object
446  4, // array
447  5, // string
448  1, // boolean
449  2, // integer
450  2, // unsigned
451  2, // float
452  }};
453 
454  // discarded values are not comparable
455  if(lhs == value_t::discarded or rhs == value_t::discarded) {
456  return false;
457  }
458 
459  return order[static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs)] < order[static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs)];
460 }
461 
463 // helpers //
465 
466 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
467 template <bool B, typename T = void>
468 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
469 
470 template <typename T>
471 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
472 
473 /*
474 Implementation of two C++17 constructs: conjunction, negation. This is needed
475 to avoid evaluating all the traits in a condition
476 
477 For example: not std::is_same<void, T>::value and has_value_type<T>::value
478 will not compile when T = void (on MSVC at least). Whereas
479 conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, T>>, has_value_type<T>>::value will
480 stop evaluating if negation<...>::value == false
481 
482 Please note that those constructs must be used with caution, since symbols can
483 become very long quickly (which can slow down compilation and cause MSVC
484 internal compiler errors). Only use it when you have to (see example ahead).
485 */
486 template <class...>
487 struct conjunction : std::true_type {};
488 template <class B1>
489 struct conjunction<B1> : B1 {};
490 template <class B1, class... Bn>
491 struct conjunction<B1, Bn...> : std::conditional<bool(B1::value), conjunction<Bn...>, B1>::type {};
492 
493 template <class B>
494 struct negation : std::integral_constant<bool, !B::value> {};
495 
496 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
497 template <unsigned N>
498 struct priority_tag : priority_tag<N - 1> {};
499 template <>
500 struct priority_tag<0> {};
501 
503 // constructors //
505 
506 template <value_t>
507 struct external_constructor;
508 
509 template <>
510 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean> {
511  template <typename BasicJsonType>
512  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept {
513  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
514  j.m_value = b;
515  j.assert_invariant();
516  }
517 };
518 
519 template <>
520 struct external_constructor<value_t::string> {
521  template <typename BasicJsonType>
522  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s) {
523  j.m_type = value_t::string;
524  j.m_value = s;
525  j.assert_invariant();
526  }
527 };
528 
529 template <>
530 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float> {
531  template <typename BasicJsonType>
532  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept {
533  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
534  j.m_value = val;
535  j.assert_invariant();
536  }
537 };
538 
539 template <>
540 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned> {
541  template <typename BasicJsonType>
542  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept {
543  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
544  j.m_value = val;
545  j.assert_invariant();
546  }
547 };
548 
549 template <>
550 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer> {
551  template <typename BasicJsonType>
552  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept {
553  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
554  j.m_value = val;
555  j.assert_invariant();
556  }
557 };
558 
559 template <>
560 struct external_constructor<value_t::array> {
561  template <typename BasicJsonType>
562  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr) {
563  j.m_type = value_t::array;
564  j.m_value = arr;
565  j.assert_invariant();
566  }
567 
568  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
569  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType, typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value, int> = 0>
570  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr) {
571  using std::begin;
572  using std::end;
573  j.m_type = value_t::array;
574  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
575  j.assert_invariant();
576  }
577 
578  template <typename BasicJsonType>
579  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr) {
580  j.m_type = value_t::array;
581  j.m_value = value_t::array;
582  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
583  for(bool x : arr) {
584  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
585  }
586  j.assert_invariant();
587  }
588 };
589 
590 template <>
591 struct external_constructor<value_t::object> {
592  template <typename BasicJsonType>
593  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj) {
594  j.m_type = value_t::object;
595  j.m_value = obj;
596  j.assert_invariant();
597  }
598 
599  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
600  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType, typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value, int> = 0>
601  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj) {
602  using std::begin;
603  using std::end;
604 
605  j.m_type = value_t::object;
606  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
607  j.assert_invariant();
608  }
609 };
610 
612 // has_/is_ functions //
614 
625 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(type) \
626  template <typename T> \
627  struct has_##type { \
628  private: \
629  template <typename U, typename = typename U::type> \
630  static int detect(U&&); \
631  static void detect(...); \
632  \
633  public: \
634  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(std::declval<T>()))>::value; \
635  }
636 
637 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(mapped_type);
638 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(key_type);
639 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(value_type);
640 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(iterator);
641 
642 #undef NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER
643 
644 template <bool B, class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
645 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
646 
647 template <class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
648 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl<true, RealType, CompatibleObjectType> {
649  static constexpr auto value =
650  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::key_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
651  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::mapped_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
652 };
653 
654 template <class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleObjectType>
655 struct is_compatible_object_type {
656  static auto constexpr value = is_compatible_object_type_impl<
657  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleObjectType>>, has_mapped_type<CompatibleObjectType>,
658  has_key_type<CompatibleObjectType>>::value,
659  typename BasicJsonType::object_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value;
660 };
661 
662 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
663 struct is_basic_json_nested_type {
664  static auto constexpr value = std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::value or
665  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_iterator>::value or
666  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::reverse_iterator>::value or
667  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_reverse_iterator>::value or
668  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::json_pointer>::value;
669 };
670 
671 template <class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleArrayType>
672 struct is_compatible_array_type {
673  static auto constexpr value =
674  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleArrayType>>,
675  negation<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
676  negation<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleArrayType>>,
677  negation<is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
678  has_value_type<CompatibleArrayType>, has_iterator<CompatibleArrayType>>::value;
679 };
680 
681 template <bool, typename, typename>
682 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
683 
684 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
685 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<true, RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType> {
686  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
687  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
688  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
689 
690  static constexpr auto value = std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
691  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
692 };
693 
694 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
695 struct is_compatible_integer_type {
696  static constexpr auto value =
697  is_compatible_integer_type_impl < std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
698  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
699  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType > ::value;
700 };
701 
702 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
703 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
704 struct has_from_json {
705  private:
706  // also check the return type of from_json
707  template <typename U,
708  typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<void, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType>(),
709  std::declval<T&>()))>::value>>
710  static int detect(U&&);
711  static void detect(...);
712 
713  public:
714  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
715  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
716 };
717 
718 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
719 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
720 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
721 struct has_non_default_from_json {
722  private:
723  template <typename U, typename = enable_if_t<
724  std::is_same<T, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType>()))>::value>>
725  static int detect(U&&);
726  static void detect(...);
727 
728  public:
729  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
730  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
731 };
732 
733 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
734 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
735 struct has_to_json {
736  private:
737  template <typename U, typename = decltype(uncvref_t<U>::to_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType&>(), std::declval<T>()))>
738  static int detect(U&&);
739  static void detect(...);
740 
741  public:
742  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
743  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
744 };
745 
747 // to_json //
749 
750 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
751  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
752 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept {
753  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
754 }
755 
756 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
757  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
758 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s) {
759  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
760 }
761 
762 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType, enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
763 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept {
764  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
765 }
766 
767 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
768  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t,
769  CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value,
770  int> = 0>
771 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept {
772  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(
773  j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
774 }
775 
776 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
777  enable_if_t<
778  is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
779  int> = 0>
780 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept {
781  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(
782  j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
783 }
784 
785 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
786 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept {
787  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
788  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
789 }
790 
791 template <typename BasicJsonType>
792 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e) {
793  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
794 }
795 
796 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
797  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value or
798  std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value,
799  int> = 0>
800 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr) {
801  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
802 }
803 
804 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
805  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
806 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& arr) {
807  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, arr);
808 }
809 
810 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
811  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, T (&)[N]>::value, int> = 0>
812 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T (&arr)[N]) {
813  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
814 }
815 
817 // from_json //
819 
820 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
821 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
822  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
823  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
824  int> = 0>
825 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val) {
826  switch(static_cast<value_t>(j)) {
827  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
828  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
829  break;
830  }
831  case value_t::number_integer: {
832  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
833  break;
834  }
835  case value_t::number_float: {
836  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
837  break;
838  }
839  default: {
840  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + j.type_name()));
841  }
842  }
843 }
844 
845 template <typename BasicJsonType>
846 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b) {
847  if(not j.is_boolean()) {
848  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + j.type_name()));
849  }
850  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
851 }
852 
853 template <typename BasicJsonType>
854 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s) {
855  if(not j.is_string()) {
856  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + j.type_name()));
857  }
858  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
859 }
860 
861 template <typename BasicJsonType>
862 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val) {
863  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
864 }
865 
866 template <typename BasicJsonType>
867 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val) {
868  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
869 }
870 
871 template <typename BasicJsonType>
872 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val) {
873  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
874 }
875 
876 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
877 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e) {
878  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
879  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
880  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
881 }
882 
883 template <typename BasicJsonType>
884 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr) {
885  if(not j.is_array()) {
886  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
887  }
888  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
889 }
890 
891 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
892 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
893  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
894 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l) {
895  if(not j.is_array()) {
896  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
897  }
898 
899  for(auto it = j.rbegin(), end = j.rend(); it != end; ++it) {
900  l.push_front(it->template get<T>());
901  }
902 }
903 
904 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
905 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<0>) {
906  using std::begin;
907  using std::end;
908 
909  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(), std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType& i) {
910  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
911  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
912  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
913  });
914 }
915 
916 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
917 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1>)
918  -> decltype(arr.reserve(std::declval<typename CompatibleArrayType::size_type>()), void()) {
919  using std::begin;
920  using std::end;
921 
922  arr.reserve(j.size());
923  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(), std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType& i) {
924  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
925  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
926  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
927  });
928 }
929 
930 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
931  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
932  std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value and
933  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value,
934  int> = 0>
935 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr) {
936  if(not j.is_array()) {
937  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
938  }
939 
940  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<1>{});
941 }
942 
943 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
944  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
945 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleObjectType& obj) {
946  if(not j.is_object()) {
947  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + j.type_name()));
948  }
949 
950  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
951  using std::begin;
952  using std::end;
953  // we could avoid the assignment, but this might require a for loop, which
954  // might be less efficient than the container constructor for some
955  // containers (would it?)
956  obj = CompatibleObjectType(begin(*inner_object), end(*inner_object));
957 }
958 
959 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
960 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
961 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
962 // an arithmetic type?
963 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
964  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
965  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
966  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
967  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
968  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
969  int> = 0>
970 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val) {
971  switch(static_cast<value_t>(j)) {
972  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
973  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
974  break;
975  }
976  case value_t::number_integer: {
977  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
978  break;
979  }
980  case value_t::number_float: {
981  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
982  break;
983  }
984  case value_t::boolean: {
985  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
986  break;
987  }
988  default: {
989  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + j.type_name()));
990  }
991  }
992 }
993 
994 struct to_json_fn {
995  private:
996  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
997  auto call(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val, priority_tag<1>) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
998  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void()) {
999  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
1000  }
1001 
1002  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1003  void call(BasicJsonType&, T&&, priority_tag<0>) const noexcept {
1004  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0, "could not find to_json() method in T's namespace");
1005  }
1006 
1007  public:
1008  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1009  void operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const
1010  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<to_json_fn>().call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1>{}))) {
1011  return call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1>{});
1012  }
1013 };
1014 
1015 struct from_json_fn {
1016  private:
1017  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1018  auto call(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val, priority_tag<1>) const noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1019  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void()) {
1020  return from_json(j, val);
1021  }
1022 
1023  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1024  void call(const BasicJsonType&, T&, priority_tag<0>) const noexcept {
1025  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0, "could not find from_json() method in T's namespace");
1026  }
1027 
1028  public:
1029  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1030  void operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1031  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<from_json_fn>().call(j, val, priority_tag<1>{}))) {
1032  return call(j, val, priority_tag<1>{});
1033  }
1034 };
1035 
1036 // taken from ranges-v3
1037 template <typename T>
1038 struct static_const {
1039  static constexpr T value{};
1040 };
1041 
1042 template <typename T>
1043 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
1044 } // namespace detail
1045 
1047 namespace {
1048 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
1049 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
1050 } // namespace
1051 
1059 template <typename = void, typename = void>
1060 struct adl_serializer {
1070  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
1071  static void from_json(BasicJsonType&& j,
1072  ValueType& val) noexcept(noexcept(::possumwood::io::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j),
1073  val))) {
1074  ::possumwood::io::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val);
1075  }
1076 
1086  template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
1087  static void to_json(BasicJsonType& j,
1088  ValueType&& val) noexcept(noexcept(::possumwood::io::to_json(j,
1089  std::forward<ValueType>(val)))) {
1090  ::possumwood::io::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val));
1091  }
1092 };
1093 
1175 template <template <typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType = std::map,
1176  template <typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector, class StringType = std::string,
1177  class BooleanType = bool, class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t, class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
1178  class NumberFloatType = double, template <typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
1179  template <typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer = adl_serializer>
1180 class basic_json {
1181  private:
1182  template <detail::value_t>
1183  friend struct detail::external_constructor;
1185  using basic_json_t = basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType, NumberIntegerType,
1186  NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>;
1187 
1188  public:
1189  using value_t = detail::value_t;
1190  // forward declarations
1191  template <typename U>
1192  class iter_impl;
1193  template <typename Base>
1194  class json_reverse_iterator;
1195  class json_pointer;
1196  template <typename T, typename SFINAE>
1197  using json_serializer = JSONSerializer<T, SFINAE>;
1198 
1200  // exceptions //
1202 
1206 
1208  using exception = detail::exception;
1210  using parse_error = detail::parse_error;
1212  using invalid_iterator = detail::invalid_iterator;
1214  using type_error = detail::type_error;
1216  using out_of_range = detail::out_of_range;
1218  using other_error = detail::other_error;
1219 
1221 
1223  // container types //
1225 
1230 
1232  using value_type = basic_json;
1233 
1235  using reference = value_type&;
1237  using const_reference = const value_type&;
1238 
1240  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
1242  using size_type = std::size_t;
1243 
1245  using allocator_type = AllocatorType<basic_json>;
1246 
1248  using pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::pointer;
1250  using const_pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::const_pointer;
1251 
1253  using iterator = iter_impl<basic_json>;
1255  using const_iterator = iter_impl<const basic_json>;
1257  using reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::iterator>;
1259  using const_reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::const_iterator>;
1260 
1262 
1266  static allocator_type get_allocator() {
1267  return allocator_type();
1268  }
1269 
1294  static basic_json meta() {
1295  basic_json result;
1296 
1297  result["copyright"] = "(C) 2013-2017 Niels Lohmann";
1298  result["name"] = "JSON for Modern C++";
1299  result["url"] = "https://github.com/nlohmann/json";
1300  result["version"] = {{"string", "2.1.1"}, {"major", 2}, {"minor", 1}, {"patch", 1}};
1301 
1302 #ifdef _WIN32
1303  result["platform"] = "win32";
1304 #elif defined __linux__
1305  result["platform"] = "linux";
1306 #elif defined __APPLE__
1307  result["platform"] = "apple";
1308 #elif defined __unix__
1309  result["platform"] = "unix";
1310 #else
1311  result["platform"] = "unknown";
1312 #endif
1313 
1314 #if defined(__clang__)
1315  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "clang"}, {"version", __clang_version__}};
1316 #elif defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
1317  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "icc"}, {"version", __INTEL_COMPILER}};
1318 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
1319  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "gcc"},
1320  {"version", std::to_string(__GNUC__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_MINOR__) + "." +
1321  std::to_string(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)}};
1322 #elif defined(__HP_cc) || defined(__HP_aCC)
1323  result["compiler"] = "hp"
1324 #elif defined(__IBMCPP__)
1325  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "ilecpp"}, {"version", __IBMCPP__}};
1326 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
1327  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "msvc"}, {"version", _MSC_VER}};
1328 #elif defined(__PGI)
1329  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "pgcpp"}, {"version", __PGI}};
1330 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
1331  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "sunpro"}, {"version", __SUNPRO_CC}};
1332 #else
1333  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "unknown"}, {"version", "unknown"}};
1334 #endif
1335 
1336 #ifdef __cplusplus
1337  result["compiler"]["c++"] = std::to_string(__cplusplus);
1338 #else
1339  result["compiler"]["c++"] = "unknown";
1340 #endif
1341  return result;
1342  }
1343 
1345  // JSON value data types //
1347 
1352 
1436  using object_t = ObjectType<StringType, basic_json, std::less<StringType>,
1437  AllocatorType<std::pair<const StringType, basic_json>>>;
1438 
1483  using array_t = ArrayType<basic_json, AllocatorType<basic_json>>;
1484 
1536  using string_t = StringType;
1537 
1562  using boolean_t = BooleanType;
1563 
1634  using number_integer_t = NumberIntegerType;
1635 
1705  using number_unsigned_t = NumberUnsignedType;
1706 
1773  using number_float_t = NumberFloatType;
1774 
1776 
1777  private:
1779  template <typename T, typename... Args>
1780  static T* create(Args&&... args) {
1781  AllocatorType<T> alloc;
1782  auto deleter = [&](T* object) { alloc.deallocate(object, 1); };
1783  std::unique_ptr<T, decltype(deleter)> object(alloc.allocate(1), deleter);
1784  alloc.construct(object.get(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
1785  assert(object != nullptr);
1786  return object.release();
1787  }
1788 
1790  // JSON value storage //
1792 
1817  union json_value {
1819  object_t* object;
1821  array_t* array;
1823  string_t* string;
1825  boolean_t boolean;
1827  number_integer_t number_integer;
1829  number_unsigned_t number_unsigned;
1831  number_float_t number_float;
1832 
1834  json_value() = default;
1836  json_value(boolean_t v) noexcept : boolean(v) {
1837  }
1839  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {
1840  }
1842  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {
1843  }
1845  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {
1846  }
1848  json_value(value_t t) {
1849  switch(t) {
1850  case value_t::object: {
1851  object = create<object_t>();
1852  break;
1853  }
1854 
1855  case value_t::array: {
1856  array = create<array_t>();
1857  break;
1858  }
1859 
1860  case value_t::string: {
1861  string = create<string_t>("");
1862  break;
1863  }
1864 
1865  case value_t::boolean: {
1866  boolean = boolean_t(false);
1867  break;
1868  }
1869 
1870  case value_t::number_integer: {
1871  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
1872  break;
1873  }
1874 
1875  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
1876  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
1877  break;
1878  }
1879 
1880  case value_t::number_float: {
1881  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
1882  break;
1883  }
1884 
1885  case value_t::null: {
1886  break;
1887  }
1888 
1889  default: {
1890  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null)) {
1891  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(
1892  500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 2.1.1")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1893  }
1894  break;
1895  }
1896  }
1897  }
1898 
1900  json_value(const string_t& value) {
1901  string = create<string_t>(value);
1902  }
1903 
1905  json_value(const object_t& value) {
1906  object = create<object_t>(value);
1907  }
1908 
1910  json_value(const array_t& value) {
1911  array = create<array_t>(value);
1912  }
1913  };
1914 
1924  void assert_invariant() const {
1925  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
1926  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
1927  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
1928  }
1929 
1930  public:
1932  // JSON parser callback //
1934 
1945  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t {
1947  object_start,
1949  object_end,
1951  array_start,
1953  array_end,
1955  key,
1957  value
1958  };
1959 
2014  using parser_callback_t = std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, basic_json& parsed)>;
2015 
2017  // constructors //
2019 
2024 
2049  basic_json(const value_t value_type) : m_type(value_type), m_value(value_type) {
2050  assert_invariant();
2051  }
2052 
2071  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept : basic_json(value_t::null) {
2072  assert_invariant();
2073  }
2074 
2128  template <
2129  typename CompatibleType, typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
2130  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_base_of<std::istream, U>::value and not std::is_same<U, basic_json_t>::value and
2131  not detail::is_basic_json_nested_type<basic_json_t, U>::value and
2132  detail::has_to_json<basic_json, U>::value,
2133  int> = 0>
2134  basic_json(CompatibleType&& val) noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(std::declval<basic_json_t&>(),
2135  std::forward<CompatibleType>(val)))) {
2136  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
2137  assert_invariant();
2138  }
2139 
2211  basic_json(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init, bool type_deduction = true,
2212  value_t manual_type = value_t::array) {
2213  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
2214  // element is a string
2215  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(), [](const basic_json& element) {
2216  return element.is_array() and element.size() == 2 and element[0].is_string();
2217  });
2218 
2219  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
2220  if(not type_deduction) {
2221  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
2222  if(manual_type == value_t::array) {
2223  is_an_object = false;
2224  }
2225 
2226  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
2227  if(manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object) {
2228  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
2229  }
2230  }
2231 
2232  if(is_an_object) {
2233  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
2234  m_type = value_t::object;
2235  m_value = value_t::object;
2236 
2237  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const basic_json& element) {
2238  m_value.object->emplace(*(element[0].m_value.string), element[1]);
2239  });
2240  }
2241  else {
2242  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
2243  m_type = value_t::array;
2244  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init);
2245  }
2246 
2247  assert_invariant();
2248  }
2249 
2284  static basic_json array(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init = std::initializer_list<basic_json>()) {
2285  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
2286  }
2287 
2323  static basic_json object(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init = std::initializer_list<basic_json>()) {
2324  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
2325  }
2326 
2345  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val) : m_type(value_t::array) {
2346  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
2347  assert_invariant();
2348  }
2349 
2392  template <class InputIT,
2393  typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
2394  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value,
2395  int>::type = 0>
2396  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last) {
2397  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
2398  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
2399 
2400  // make sure iterator fits the current value
2401  if(first.m_object != last.m_object) {
2402  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
2403  }
2404 
2405  // copy type from first iterator
2406  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
2407 
2408  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
2409  switch(m_type) {
2410  case value_t::boolean:
2411  case value_t::number_float:
2412  case value_t::number_integer:
2413  case value_t::number_unsigned:
2414  case value_t::string: {
2415  if(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin() or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()) {
2416  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
2417  }
2418  break;
2419  }
2420 
2421  default: {
2422  break;
2423  }
2424  }
2425 
2426  switch(m_type) {
2427  case value_t::number_integer: {
2428  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
2429  break;
2430  }
2431 
2432  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
2433  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
2434  break;
2435  }
2436 
2437  case value_t::number_float: {
2438  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
2439  break;
2440  }
2441 
2442  case value_t::boolean: {
2443  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
2444  break;
2445  }
2446 
2447  case value_t::string: {
2448  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
2449  break;
2450  }
2451 
2452  case value_t::object: {
2453  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
2454  break;
2455  }
2456 
2457  case value_t::array: {
2458  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator, last.m_it.array_iterator);
2459  break;
2460  }
2461 
2462  default: {
2463  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(
2464  206, "cannot construct with iterators from " + first.m_object->type_name()));
2465  }
2466  }
2467 
2468  assert_invariant();
2469  }
2470 
2472  // other constructors and destructor //
2474 
2495  basic_json(const basic_json& other) : m_type(other.m_type) {
2496  // check of passed value is valid
2497  other.assert_invariant();
2498 
2499  switch(m_type) {
2500  case value_t::object: {
2501  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
2502  break;
2503  }
2504 
2505  case value_t::array: {
2506  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
2507  break;
2508  }
2509 
2510  case value_t::string: {
2511  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
2512  break;
2513  }
2514 
2515  case value_t::boolean: {
2516  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
2517  break;
2518  }
2519 
2520  case value_t::number_integer: {
2521  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
2522  break;
2523  }
2524 
2525  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
2526  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
2527  break;
2528  }
2529 
2530  case value_t::number_float: {
2531  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
2532  break;
2533  }
2534 
2535  default: {
2536  break;
2537  }
2538  }
2539 
2540  assert_invariant();
2541  }
2542 
2561  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)), m_value(std::move(other.m_value)) {
2562  // check that passed value is valid
2563  other.assert_invariant();
2564 
2565  // invalidate payload
2566  other.m_type = value_t::null;
2567  other.m_value = {};
2568 
2569  assert_invariant();
2570  }
2571 
2595  reference& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept(
2596  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
2597  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
2598  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value) {
2599  // check that passed value is valid
2600  other.assert_invariant();
2601 
2602  using std::swap;
2603  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
2604  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
2605 
2606  assert_invariant();
2607  return *this;
2608  }
2609 
2625  ~basic_json() {
2626  assert_invariant();
2627 
2628  switch(m_type) {
2629  case value_t::object: {
2630  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
2631  alloc.destroy(m_value.object);
2632  alloc.deallocate(m_value.object, 1);
2633  break;
2634  }
2635 
2636  case value_t::array: {
2637  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
2638  alloc.destroy(m_value.array);
2639  alloc.deallocate(m_value.array, 1);
2640  break;
2641  }
2642 
2643  case value_t::string: {
2644  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
2645  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
2646  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
2647  break;
2648  }
2649 
2650  default: {
2651  // all other types need no specific destructor
2652  break;
2653  }
2654  }
2655  }
2656 
2658 
2659  public:
2661  // object inspection //
2663 
2667 
2693  string_t dump(const int indent = -1, const char indent_char = ' ') const {
2694  string_t result;
2695  serializer s(output_adapter<char>::create(result), indent_char);
2696 
2697  if(indent >= 0) {
2698  s.dump(*this, true, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
2699  }
2700  else {
2701  s.dump(*this, false, 0);
2702  }
2703 
2704  return result;
2705  }
2706 
2725  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept {
2726  return m_type;
2727  }
2728 
2754  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept {
2755  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
2756  }
2757 
2780  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept {
2781  return is_array() or is_object();
2782  }
2783 
2801  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept {
2802  return m_type == value_t::null;
2803  }
2804 
2822  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept {
2823  return m_type == value_t::boolean;
2824  }
2825 
2851  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept {
2852  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
2853  }
2854 
2879  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept {
2880  return m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned;
2881  }
2882 
2906  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept {
2907  return m_type == value_t::number_unsigned;
2908  }
2909 
2933  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept {
2934  return m_type == value_t::number_float;
2935  }
2936 
2954  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept {
2955  return m_type == value_t::object;
2956  }
2957 
2975  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept {
2976  return m_type == value_t::array;
2977  }
2978 
2996  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept {
2997  return m_type == value_t::string;
2998  }
2999 
3022  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept {
3023  return m_type == value_t::discarded;
3024  }
3025 
3044  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept {
3045  return m_type;
3046  }
3047 
3049 
3050  private:
3052  // value access //
3054 
3056  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const {
3057  if(is_boolean()) {
3058  return m_value.boolean;
3059  }
3060 
3061  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + type_name()));
3062  }
3063 
3065  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3066  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
3067  }
3068 
3070  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3071  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
3072  }
3073 
3075  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3076  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
3077  }
3078 
3080  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3081  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
3082  }
3083 
3085  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3086  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
3087  }
3088 
3090  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3091  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
3092  }
3093 
3095  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3096  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
3097  }
3098 
3100  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3101  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
3102  }
3103 
3105  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3106  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
3107  }
3108 
3110  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3111  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
3112  }
3113 
3115  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3116  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
3117  }
3118 
3120  constexpr const number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3121  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
3122  }
3123 
3125  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept {
3126  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
3127  }
3128 
3130  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept {
3131  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
3132  }
3133 
3145  template <typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
3146  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj) {
3147  // helper type
3148  using PointerType = typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type;
3149 
3150  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
3151  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<PointerType>();
3152 
3153  if(ptr != nullptr) {
3154  return *ptr;
3155  }
3156 
3157  JSON_THROW(
3158  type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + obj.type_name()));
3159  }
3160 
3161  public:
3165 
3180  template <typename BasicJsonType,
3181  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, basic_json_t>::value,
3182  int> = 0>
3183  basic_json get() const {
3184  return *this;
3185  }
3186 
3226  template <typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
3227  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3228  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3229  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
3230  int> = 0>
3231  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(),
3232  std::declval<ValueType&>()))) {
3233  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
3234  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
3235  // still need the uncvref
3236  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
3237  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
3238  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
3239  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
3240 
3241  ValueType ret;
3242  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
3243  return ret;
3244  }
3245 
3277  template <typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
3278  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3279  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
3280  int> = 0>
3281  ValueType get() const
3282  noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>()))) {
3283  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
3284  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
3285  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
3286  }
3287 
3315  template <typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3316  PointerType get() noexcept {
3317  // delegate the call to get_ptr
3318  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
3319  }
3320 
3325  template <typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3326  constexpr const PointerType get() const noexcept {
3327  // delegate the call to get_ptr
3328  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
3329  }
3330 
3357  template <typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3358  PointerType get_ptr() noexcept {
3359  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
3360  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<
3361  typename std::remove_pointer<typename std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
3362  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
3363  static_assert(std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value or
3364  std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value or
3365  std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value or
3366  std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value or
3367  std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value,
3368  "incompatible pointer type");
3369 
3370  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
3371  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
3372  }
3373 
3378  template <typename PointerType,
3379  typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
3380  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value,
3381  int>::type = 0>
3382  constexpr const PointerType get_ptr() const noexcept {
3383  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
3384  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<
3385  typename std::remove_pointer<typename std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
3386  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
3387  static_assert(std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value or
3388  std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value or
3389  std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value or
3390  std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value or
3391  std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value,
3392  "incompatible pointer type");
3393 
3394  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
3395  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<const PointerType>(nullptr));
3396  }
3397 
3424  template <typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3425  ReferenceType get_ref() {
3426  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
3427  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
3428  }
3429 
3434  template <typename ReferenceType,
3435  typename std::enable_if<std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
3436  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value,
3437  int>::type = 0>
3438  ReferenceType get_ref() const {
3439  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
3440  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
3441  }
3442 
3472  template <
3473  typename ValueType,
3474  typename std::enable_if<
3475  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value
3476 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
3477  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
3478 #endif
3479 #if(defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || \
3480  (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER > 1900 && defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
3481  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
3482 #endif
3483  ,
3484  int>::type = 0>
3485  operator ValueType() const {
3486  // delegate the call to get<>() const
3487  return get<ValueType>();
3488  }
3489 
3491 
3493  // element access //
3495 
3499 
3526  reference at(size_type idx) {
3527  // at only works for arrays
3528  if(is_array()) {
3529  JSON_TRY {
3530  return m_value.array->at(idx);
3531  }
3532  JSON_CATCH(std::out_of_range&) {
3533  // create better exception explanation
3534  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
3535  }
3536  }
3537  else {
3538  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3539  }
3540  }
3541 
3568  const_reference at(size_type idx) const {
3569  // at only works for arrays
3570  if(is_array()) {
3571  JSON_TRY {
3572  return m_value.array->at(idx);
3573  }
3574  JSON_CATCH(std::out_of_range&) {
3575  // create better exception explanation
3576  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
3577  }
3578  }
3579  else {
3580  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3581  }
3582  }
3583 
3614  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) {
3615  // at only works for objects
3616  if(is_object()) {
3617  JSON_TRY {
3618  return m_value.object->at(key);
3619  }
3620  JSON_CATCH(std::out_of_range&) {
3621  // create better exception explanation
3622  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
3623  }
3624  }
3625  else {
3626  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3627  }
3628  }
3629 
3660  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const {
3661  // at only works for objects
3662  if(is_object()) {
3663  JSON_TRY {
3664  return m_value.object->at(key);
3665  }
3666  JSON_CATCH(std::out_of_range&) {
3667  // create better exception explanation
3668  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
3669  }
3670  }
3671  else {
3672  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3673  }
3674  }
3675 
3701  reference operator[](size_type idx) {
3702  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
3703  if(is_null()) {
3704  m_type = value_t::array;
3705  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
3706  assert_invariant();
3707  }
3708 
3709  // operator[] only works for arrays
3710  if(is_array()) {
3711  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
3712  if(idx >= m_value.array->size()) {
3713  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(), idx - m_value.array->size() + 1, basic_json());
3714  }
3715 
3716  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
3717  }
3718 
3719  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3720  }
3721 
3741  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const {
3742  // const operator[] only works for arrays
3743  if(is_array()) {
3744  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
3745  }
3746 
3747  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3748  }
3749 
3777  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) {
3778  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
3779  if(is_null()) {
3780  m_type = value_t::object;
3781  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
3782  assert_invariant();
3783  }
3784 
3785  // operator[] only works for objects
3786  if(is_object()) {
3787  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
3788  }
3789 
3790  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3791  }
3792 
3823  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const {
3824  // const operator[] only works for objects
3825  if(is_object()) {
3826  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
3827  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
3828  }
3829 
3830  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3831  }
3832 
3860  template <typename T, std::size_t n>
3861  reference operator[](T* (&key)[n]) {
3862  return operator[](static_cast<const T>(key));
3863  }
3864 
3894  template <typename T, std::size_t n>
3895  const_reference operator[](T* (&key)[n]) const {
3896  return operator[](static_cast<const T>(key));
3897  }
3898 
3926  template <typename T>
3927  reference operator[](T* key) {
3928  // implicitly convert null to object
3929  if(is_null()) {
3930  m_type = value_t::object;
3931  m_value = value_t::object;
3932  assert_invariant();
3933  }
3934 
3935  // at only works for objects
3936  if(is_object()) {
3937  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
3938  }
3939 
3940  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3941  }
3942 
3973  template <typename T>
3974  const_reference operator[](T* key) const {
3975  // at only works for objects
3976  if(is_object()) {
3977  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
3978  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
3979  }
3980 
3981  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
3982  }
3983 
4032  template <class ValueType,
4033  typename std::enable_if<std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
4034  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, ValueType default_value) const {
4035  // at only works for objects
4036  if(is_object()) {
4037  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
4038  const auto it = find(key);
4039  if(it != end()) {
4040  return *it;
4041  }
4042 
4043  return default_value;
4044  }
4045  else {
4046  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + type_name()));
4047  }
4048  }
4049 
4054  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const {
4055  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
4056  }
4057 
4099  template <class ValueType,
4100  typename std::enable_if<std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
4101  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, ValueType default_value) const {
4102  // at only works for objects
4103  if(is_object()) {
4104  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
4105  JSON_TRY {
4106  return ptr.get_checked(this);
4107  }
4108  JSON_CATCH(out_of_range&) {
4109  return default_value;
4110  }
4111  }
4112 
4113  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + type_name()));
4114  }
4115 
4120  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const {
4121  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
4122  }
4123 
4149  reference front() {
4150  return *begin();
4151  }
4152 
4156  const_reference front() const {
4157  return *cbegin();
4158  }
4159 
4191  reference back() {
4192  auto tmp = end();
4193  --tmp;
4194  return *tmp;
4195  }
4196 
4200  const_reference back() const {
4201  auto tmp = cend();
4202  --tmp;
4203  return *tmp;
4204  }
4205 
4252  template <class IteratorType,
4253  typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
4254  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value,
4255  int>::type = 0>
4256  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos) {
4257  // make sure iterator fits the current value
4258  if(this != pos.m_object) {
4259  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
4260  }
4261 
4262  IteratorType result = end();
4263 
4264  switch(m_type) {
4265  case value_t::boolean:
4266  case value_t::number_float:
4267  case value_t::number_integer:
4268  case value_t::number_unsigned:
4269  case value_t::string: {
4270  if(not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()) {
4271  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
4272  }
4273 
4274  if(is_string()) {
4275  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
4276  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
4277  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
4278  m_value.string = nullptr;
4279  }
4280 
4281  m_type = value_t::null;
4282  assert_invariant();
4283  break;
4284  }
4285 
4286  case value_t::object: {
4287  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
4288  break;
4289  }
4290 
4291  case value_t::array: {
4292  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
4293  break;
4294  }
4295 
4296  default: {
4297  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4298  }
4299  }
4300 
4301  return result;
4302  }
4303 
4350  template <class IteratorType,
4351  typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
4352  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value,
4353  int>::type = 0>
4354  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last) {
4355  // make sure iterator fits the current value
4356  if(this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object) {
4357  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
4358  }
4359 
4360  IteratorType result = end();
4361 
4362  switch(m_type) {
4363  case value_t::boolean:
4364  case value_t::number_float:
4365  case value_t::number_integer:
4366  case value_t::number_unsigned:
4367  case value_t::string: {
4368  if(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin() or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()) {
4369  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
4370  }
4371 
4372  if(is_string()) {
4373  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
4374  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
4375  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
4376  m_value.string = nullptr;
4377  }
4378 
4379  m_type = value_t::null;
4380  assert_invariant();
4381  break;
4382  }
4383 
4384  case value_t::object: {
4385  result.m_it.object_iterator =
4386  m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
4387  break;
4388  }
4389 
4390  case value_t::array: {
4391  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator, last.m_it.array_iterator);
4392  break;
4393  }
4394 
4395  default: {
4396  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4397  }
4398  }
4399 
4400  return result;
4401  }
4402 
4432  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key) {
4433  // this erase only works for objects
4434  if(is_object()) {
4435  return m_value.object->erase(key);
4436  }
4437 
4438  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4439  }
4440 
4465  void erase(const size_type idx) {
4466  // this erase only works for arrays
4467  if(is_array()) {
4468  if(idx >= size()) {
4469  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
4470  }
4471 
4472  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
4473  }
4474  else {
4475  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4476  }
4477  }
4478 
4480 
4482  // lookup //
4484 
4487 
4510  iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key) {
4511  auto result = end();
4512 
4513  if(is_object()) {
4514  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
4515  }
4516 
4517  return result;
4518  }
4519 
4524  const_iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key) const {
4525  auto result = cend();
4526 
4527  if(is_object()) {
4528  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
4529  }
4530 
4531  return result;
4532  }
4533 
4555  size_type count(typename object_t::key_type key) const {
4556  // return 0 for all nonobject types
4557  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(key) : 0;
4558  }
4559

4563  // iterators //
4565 
4568 
4593  iterator begin() noexcept {
4594  iterator result(this);
4595  result.set_begin();
4596  return result;
4597  }
4598 
4602  const_iterator begin() const noexcept {
4603  return cbegin();
4604  }
4605 
4631  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept {
4632  const_iterator result(this);
4633  result.set_begin();
4634  return result;
4635  }
4636 
4661  iterator end() noexcept {
4662  iterator result(this);
4663  result.set_end();
4664  return result;
4665  }
4666 
4670  const_iterator end() const noexcept {
4671  return cend();
4672  }
4673 
4699  const_iterator cend() const noexcept {
4700  const_iterator result(this);
4701  result.set_end();
4702  return result;
4703  }
4704 
4728  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept {
4729  return reverse_iterator(end());
4730  }
4731 
4735  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept {
4736  return crbegin();
4737  }
4738 
4763  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept {
4764  return reverse_iterator(begin());
4765  }
4766 
4770  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept {
4771  return crend();
4772  }
4773 
4798  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept {
4799  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
4800  }
4801 
4826  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept {
4827  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
4828  }
4829 
4830  private:
4831  // forward declaration
4832  template <typename IteratorType>
4833  class iteration_proxy;
4834 
4835  public:
4849  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference cont) {
4850  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(cont);
4851  }
4852 
4856  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference cont) {
4857  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(cont);
4858  }
4859 
4861 
4863  // capacity //
4865 
4868 
4906  bool empty() const noexcept {
4907  switch(m_type) {
4908  case value_t::null: {
4909  // null values are empty
4910  return true;
4911  }
4912 
4913  case value_t::array: {
4914  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
4915  return m_value.array->empty();
4916  }
4917 
4918  case value_t::object: {
4919  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
4920  return m_value.object->empty();
4921  }
4922 
4923  default: {
4924  // all other types are nonempty
4925  return false;
4926  }
4927  }
4928  }
4929 
4968  size_type size() const noexcept {
4969  switch(m_type) {
4970  case value_t::null: {
4971  // null values are empty
4972  return 0;
4973  }
4974 
4975  case value_t::array: {
4976  // delegate call to array_t::size()
4977  return m_value.array->size();
4978  }
4979 
4980  case value_t::object: {
4981  // delegate call to object_t::size()
4982  return m_value.object->size();
4983  }
4984 
4985  default: {
4986  // all other types have size 1
4987  return 1;
4988  }
4989  }
4990  }
4991 
5028  size_type max_size() const noexcept {
5029  switch(m_type) {
5030  case value_t::array: {
5031  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
5032  return m_value.array->max_size();
5033  }
5034 
5035  case value_t::object: {
5036  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
5037  return m_value.object->max_size();
5038  }
5039 
5040  default: {
5041  // all other types have max_size() == size()
5042  return size();
5043  }
5044  }
5045  }
5046 
5048 
5050  // modifiers //
5052 
5055 
5078  void clear() noexcept {
5079  switch(m_type) {
5080  case value_t::number_integer: {
5081  m_value.number_integer = 0;
5082  break;
5083  }
5084 
5085  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
5086  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
5087  break;
5088  }
5089 
5090  case value_t::number_float: {
5091  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
5092  break;
5093  }
5094 
5095  case value_t::boolean: {
5096  m_value.boolean = false;
5097  break;
5098  }
5099 
5100  case value_t::string: {
5101  m_value.string->clear();
5102  break;
5103  }
5104 
5105  case value_t::array: {
5106  m_value.array->clear();
5107  break;
5108  }
5109 
5110  case value_t::object: {
5111  m_value.object->clear();
5112  break;
5113  }
5114 
5115  default: {
5116  break;
5117  }
5118  }
5119  }
5120 
5141  void push_back(basic_json&& val) {
5142  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
5143  if(not(is_null() or is_array())) {
5144  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5145  }
5146 
5147  // transform null object into an array
5148  if(is_null()) {
5149  m_type = value_t::array;
5150  m_value = value_t::array;
5151  assert_invariant();
5152  }
5153 
5154  // add element to array (move semantics)
5155  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
5156  // invalidate object
5157  val.m_type = value_t::null;
5158  }
5159 
5164  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val) {
5165  push_back(std::move(val));
5166  return *this;
5167  }
5168 
5173  void push_back(const basic_json& val) {
5174  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
5175  if(not(is_null() or is_array())) {
5176  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5177  }
5178 
5179  // transform null object into an array
5180  if(is_null()) {
5181  m_type = value_t::array;
5182  m_value = value_t::array;
5183  assert_invariant();
5184  }
5185 
5186  // add element to array
5187  m_value.array->push_back(val);
5188  }
5189 
5194  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val) {
5195  push_back(val);
5196  return *this;
5197  }
5198 
5219  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val) {
5220  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
5221  if(not(is_null() or is_object())) {
5222  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5223  }
5224 
5225  // transform null object into an object
5226  if(is_null()) {
5227  m_type = value_t::object;
5228  m_value = value_t::object;
5229  assert_invariant();
5230  }
5231 
5232  // add element to array
5233  m_value.object->insert(val);
5234  }
5235 
5240  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val) {
5241  push_back(val);
5242  return *this;
5243  }
5244 
5270  void push_back(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init) {
5271  if(is_object() and init.size() == 2 and init.begin()->is_string()) {
5272  const string_t key = *init.begin();
5273  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(key, *(init.begin() + 1)));
5274  }
5275  else {
5276  push_back(basic_json(init));
5277  }
5278  }
5279 
5284  reference operator+=(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init) {
5285  push_back(init);
5286  return *this;
5287  }
5288 
5310  template <class... Args>
5311  void emplace_back(Args&&... args) {
5312  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
5313  if(not(is_null() or is_array())) {
5314  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + type_name()));
5315  }
5316 
5317  // transform null object into an array
5318  if(is_null()) {
5319  m_type = value_t::array;
5320  m_value = value_t::array;
5321  assert_invariant();
5322  }
5323 
5324  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
5325  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
5326  }
5327 
5355  template <class... Args>
5356  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&&... args) {
5357  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
5358  if(not(is_null() or is_object())) {
5359  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + type_name()));
5360  }
5361 
5362  // transform null object into an object
5363  if(is_null()) {
5364  m_type = value_t::object;
5365  m_value = value_t::object;
5366  assert_invariant();
5367  }
5368 
5369  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
5370  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
5371  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
5372  auto it = begin();
5373  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
5374 
5375  // return pair of iterator and boolean
5376  return {it, res.second};
5377  }
5378 
5401  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val) {
5402  // insert only works for arrays
5403  if(is_array()) {
5404  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5405  if(pos.m_object != this) {
5406  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5407  }
5408 
5409  // insert to array and return iterator
5410  iterator result(this);
5411  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, val);
5412  return result;
5413  }
5414 
5415  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5416  }
5417 
5422  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val) {
5423  return insert(pos, val);
5424  }
5425 
5450  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val) {
5451  // insert only works for arrays
5452  if(is_array()) {
5453  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5454  if(pos.m_object != this) {
5455  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5456  }
5457 
5458  // insert to array and return iterator
5459  iterator result(this);
5460  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
5461  return result;
5462  }
5463 
5464  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5465  }
5466 
5497  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last) {
5498  // insert only works for arrays
5499  if(not is_array()) {
5500  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5501  }
5502 
5503  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5504  if(pos.m_object != this) {
5505  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5506  }
5507 
5508  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
5509  if(first.m_object != last.m_object) {
5510  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
5511  }
5512 
5513  if(first.m_object == this or last.m_object == this) {
5514  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
5515  }
5516 
5517  // insert to array and return iterator
5518  iterator result(this);
5519  result.m_it.array_iterator =
5520  m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, first.m_it.array_iterator, last.m_it.array_iterator);
5521  return result;
5522  }
5523 
5548  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, std::initializer_list<basic_json> ilist) {
5549  // insert only works for arrays
5550  if(not is_array()) {
5551  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5552  }
5553 
5554  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5555  if(pos.m_object != this) {
5556  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5557  }
5558 
5559  // insert to array and return iterator
5560  iterator result(this);
