5561  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, ilist);
5562  return result;
5563  }
5564 
5588  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last) {
5589  // insert only works for objects
5590  if(not is_object()) {
5591  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5592  }
5593 
5594  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
5595  if(first.m_object != last.m_object) {
5596  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
5597  }
5598 
5599  // passed iterators must belong to objects
5600  if(not first.m_object->is_object() or not first.m_object->is_object()) {
5601  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
5602  }
5603 
5604  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
5605  }
5606 
5624  void swap(reference other) noexcept(
5625  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
5626  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
5627  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value) {
5628  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
5629  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
5630  assert_invariant();
5631  }
5632 
5653  void swap(array_t& other) {
5654  // swap only works for arrays
5655  if(is_array()) {
5656  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
5657  }
5658  else {
5659  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
5660  }
5661  }
5662 
5683  void swap(object_t& other) {
5684  // swap only works for objects
5685  if(is_object()) {
5686  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
5687  }
5688  else {
5689  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
5690  }
5691  }
5692 
5713  void swap(string_t& other) {
5714  // swap only works for strings
5715  if(is_string()) {
5716  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
5717  }
5718  else {
5719  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
5720  }
5721  }
5722 
5724 
5725  public:
5727  // lexicographical comparison operators //
5729 
5732 
5760  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5761  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
5762  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
5763 
5764  if(lhs_type == rhs_type) {
5765  switch(lhs_type) {
5766  case value_t::array: {
5767  return *lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array;
5768  }
5769  case value_t::object: {
5770  return *lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object;
5771  }
5772  case value_t::null: {
5773  return true;
5774  }
5775  case value_t::string: {
5776  return *lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string;
5777  }
5778  case value_t::boolean: {
5779  return lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean;
5780  }
5781  case value_t::number_integer: {
5782  return lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer;
5783  }
5784  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
5785  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
5786  }
5787  case value_t::number_float: {
5788  return lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float;
5789  }
5790  default: {
5791  return false;
5792  }
5793  }
5794  }
5795  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float) {
5796  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float;
5797  }
5798  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer) {
5799  return lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
5800  }
5801  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float) {
5802  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float;
5803  }
5804  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned) {
5805  return lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
5806  }
5807  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer) {
5808  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer;
5809  }
5810  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned) {
5811  return lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
5812  }
5813 
5814  return false;
5815  }
5816 
5821  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5822  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
5823  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
5824  }
5825 
5830  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5831  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5832  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
5833  }
5834 
5851  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5852  return not(lhs == rhs);
5853  }
5854 
5859  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5860  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
5861  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
5862  }
5863 
5868  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5869  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5870  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
5871  }
5872 
5897  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5898  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
5899  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
5900 
5901  if(lhs_type == rhs_type) {
5902  switch(lhs_type) {
5903  case value_t::array: {
5904  return *lhs.m_value.array < *rhs.m_value.array;
5905  }
5906  case value_t::object: {
5907  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
5908  }
5909  case value_t::null: {
5910  return false;
5911  }
5912  case value_t::string: {
5913  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
5914  }
5915  case value_t::boolean: {
5916  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
5917  }
5918  case value_t::number_integer: {
5919  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
5920  }
5921  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
5922  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
5923  }
5924  case value_t::number_float: {
5925  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
5926  }
5927  default: {
5928  return false;
5929  }
5930  }
5931  }
5932  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float) {
5933  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
5934  }
5935  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer) {
5936  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
5937  }
5938  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float) {
5939  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
5940  }
5941  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned) {
5942  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
5943  }
5944  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned) {
5945  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
5946  }
5947  else if(lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer) {
5948  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
5949  }
5950 
5951  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
5952  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
5953  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
5954  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
5955  }
5956 
5961  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5962  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
5963  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
5964  }
5965 
5970  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
5971  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5972  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
5973  }
5974 
5992  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
5993  return not(rhs < lhs);
5994  }
5995 
6000  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6001  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
6002  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
6003  }
6004 
6009  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6010  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
6011  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
6012  }
6013 
6031  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
6032  return not(lhs <= rhs);
6033  }
6034 
6039  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6040  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
6041  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
6042  }
6043 
6048  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6049  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
6050  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
6051  }
6052 
6070  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
6071  return not(lhs < rhs);
6072  }
6073 
6078  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6079  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept {
6080  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
6081  }
6082 
6087  template <typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6088  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept {
6089  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
6090  }
6091 
6093 
6094  private:
6096  // output adapters //
6098 
6100  template <typename CharType>
6101  class output_adapter {
6102  public:
6103  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
6104  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) = 0;
6105  virtual ~output_adapter() {
6106  }
6107 
6108  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::vector<CharType>& vec) {
6109  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_vector_adapter<CharType>(vec));
6110  }
6111 
6112  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::ostream& s) {
6113  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_stream_adapter<CharType>(s));
6114  }
6115 
6116  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::string& s) {
6117  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_string_adapter<CharType>(s));
6118  }
6119  };
6120 
6122  template <typename CharType>
6123  using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>>;
6124 
6126  template <typename CharType>
6127  class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType> {
6128  public:
6129  output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec) : v(vec) {
6130  }
6131 
6132  void write_character(CharType c) override {
6133  v.push_back(c);
6134  }
6135 
6136  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override {
6137  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
6138  }
6139 
6140  private:
6141  std::vector<CharType>& v;
6142  };
6143 
6145  template <typename CharType>
6146  class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType> {
6147  public:
6148  output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s) : stream(s) {
6149  }
6150 
6151  void write_character(CharType c) override {
6152  stream.put(c);
6153  }
6154 
6155  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override {
6156  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
6157  }
6158 
6159  private:
6160  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
6161  };
6162 
6164  template <typename CharType>
6165  class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType> {
6166  public:
6167  output_string_adapter(std::string& s) : str(s) {
6168  }
6169 
6170  void write_character(CharType c) override {
6171  str.push_back(c);
6172  }
6173 
6174  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override {
6175  str.append(s, length);
6176  }
6177 
6178  private:
6179  std::basic_string<CharType>& str;
6180  };
6181 
6183  // serialization //
6185 
6188 
6189  private:
6193  class serializer {
6194  private:
6195  serializer(const serializer&) = delete;
6196  serializer& operator=(const serializer&) = delete;
6197 
6198  public:
6203  serializer(output_adapter_t<char> s, const char ichar)
6204  : o(s), loc(std::localeconv()), thousands_sep(!loc->thousands_sep ? '\0' : loc->thousands_sep[0]),
6205  decimal_point(!loc->decimal_point ? '\0' : loc->decimal_point[0]), indent_char(ichar),
6206  indent_string(512, indent_char) {
6207  }
6208 
6226  void dump(const basic_json& val, const bool pretty_print, const unsigned int indent_step,
6227  const unsigned int current_indent = 0) {
6228  switch(val.m_type) {
6229  case value_t::object: {
6230  if(val.m_value.object->empty()) {
6231  o->write_characters("{}", 2);
6232  return;
6233  }
6234 
6235  if(pretty_print) {
6236  o->write_characters("{\n", 2);
6237 
6238  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6239  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6240  if(indent_string.size() < new_indent) {
6241  indent_string.resize(new_indent, ' ');
6242  }
6243 
6244  // first n-1 elements
6245  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6246  for(size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i) {
6247  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6248  o->write_character('\"');
6249  dump_escaped(i->first);
6250  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6251  dump(i->second, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6252  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6253  }
6254 
6255  // last element
6256  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6257  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6258  o->write_character('\"');
6259  dump_escaped(i->first);
6260  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6261  dump(i->second, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6262 
6263  o->write_character('\n');
6264  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6265  o->write_character('}');
6266  }
6267  else {
6268  o->write_character('{');
6269 
6270  // first n-1 elements
6271  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6272  for(size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i) {
6273  o->write_character('\"');
6274  dump_escaped(i->first);
6275  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6276  dump(i->second, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6277  o->write_character(',');
6278  }
6279 
6280  // last element
6281  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6282  o->write_character('\"');
6283  dump_escaped(i->first);
6284  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6285  dump(i->second, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6286 
6287  o->write_character('}');
6288  }
6289 
6290  return;
6291  }
6292 
6293  case value_t::array: {
6294  if(val.m_value.array->empty()) {
6295  o->write_characters("[]", 2);
6296  return;
6297  }
6298 
6299  if(pretty_print) {
6300  o->write_characters("[\n", 2);
6301 
6302  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6303  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6304  if(indent_string.size() < new_indent) {
6305  indent_string.resize(new_indent, ' ');
6306  }
6307 
6308  // first n-1 elements
6309  for(auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin(); i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i) {
6310  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6311  dump(*i, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6312  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6313  }
6314 
6315  // last element
6316  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6317  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6318  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), true, indent_step, new_indent);
6319 
6320  o->write_character('\n');
6321  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6322  o->write_character(']');
6323  }
6324  else {
6325  o->write_character('[');
6326 
6327  // first n-1 elements
6328  for(auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin(); i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i) {
6329  dump(*i, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6330  o->write_character(',');
6331  }
6332 
6333  // last element
6334  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6335  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), false, indent_step, current_indent);
6336 
6337  o->write_character(']');
6338  }
6339 
6340  return;
6341  }
6342 
6343  case value_t::string: {
6344  o->write_character('\"');
6345  dump_escaped(*val.m_value.string);
6346  o->write_character('\"');
6347  return;
6348  }
6349 
6350  case value_t::boolean: {
6351  if(val.m_value.boolean) {
6352  o->write_characters("true", 4);
6353  }
6354  else {
6355  o->write_characters("false", 5);
6356  }
6357  return;
6358  }
6359 
6360  case value_t::number_integer: {
6361  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_integer);
6362  return;
6363  }
6364 
6365  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
6366  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_unsigned);
6367  return;
6368  }
6369 
6370  case value_t::number_float: {
6371  dump_float(val.m_value.number_float);
6372  return;
6373  }
6374 
6375  case value_t::discarded: {
6376  o->write_characters("<discarded>", 11);
6377  return;
6378  }
6379 
6380  case value_t::null: {
6381  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6382  return;
6383  }
6384  }
6385  }
6386 
6387  private:
6396  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s) noexcept {
6397  return std::accumulate(s.begin(), s.end(), size_t{}, [](size_t res, typename string_t::value_type c) {
6398  switch(c) {
6399  case '"':
6400  case '\\':
6401  case '\b':
6402  case '\f':
6403  case '\n':
6404  case '\r':
6405  case '\t': {
6406  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
6407  return res + 1;
6408  }
6409 
6410  case 0x00:
6411  case 0x01:
6412  case 0x02:
6413  case 0x03:
6414  case 0x04:
6415  case 0x05:
6416  case 0x06:
6417  case 0x07:
6418  case 0x0b:
6419  case 0x0e:
6420  case 0x0f:
6421  case 0x10:
6422  case 0x11:
6423  case 0x12:
6424  case 0x13:
6425  case 0x14:
6426  case 0x15:
6427  case 0x16:
6428  case 0x17:
6429  case 0x18:
6430  case 0x19:
6431  case 0x1a:
6432  case 0x1b:
6433  case 0x1c:
6434  case 0x1d:
6435  case 0x1e:
6436  case 0x1f: {
6437  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
6438  return res + 5;
6439  }
6440 
6441  default: {
6442  return res;
6443  }
6444  }
6445  });
6446  }
6447 
6460  void dump_escaped(const string_t& s) const {
6461  const auto space = extra_space(s);
6462  if(space == 0) {
6463  o->write_characters(s.c_str(), s.size());
6464  return;
6465  }
6466 
6467  // create a result string of necessary size
6468  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
6469  std::size_t pos = 0;
6470 
6471  for(const auto& c : s) {
6472  switch(c) {
6473  // quotation mark (0x22)
6474  case '"': {
6475  result[pos + 1] = '"';
6476  pos += 2;
6477  break;
6478  }
6479 
6480  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
6481  case '\\': {
6482  // nothing to change
6483  pos += 2;
6484  break;
6485  }
6486 
6487  // backspace (0x08)
6488  case '\b': {
6489  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
6490  pos += 2;
6491  break;
6492  }
6493 
6494  // formfeed (0x0c)
6495  case '\f': {
6496  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
6497  pos += 2;
6498  break;
6499  }
6500 
6501  // newline (0x0a)
6502  case '\n': {
6503  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
6504  pos += 2;
6505  break;
6506  }
6507 
6508  // carriage return (0x0d)
6509  case '\r': {
6510  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
6511  pos += 2;
6512  break;
6513  }
6514 
6515  // horizontal tab (0x09)
6516  case '\t': {
6517  result[pos + 1] = 't';
6518  pos += 2;
6519  break;
6520  }
6521 
6522  case 0x00:
6523  case 0x01:
6524  case 0x02:
6525  case 0x03:
6526  case 0x04:
6527  case 0x05:
6528  case 0x06:
6529  case 0x07:
6530  case 0x0b:
6531  case 0x0e:
6532  case 0x0f:
6533  case 0x10:
6534  case 0x11:
6535  case 0x12:
6536  case 0x13:
6537  case 0x14:
6538  case 0x15:
6539  case 0x16:
6540  case 0x17:
6541  case 0x18:
6542  case 0x19:
6543  case 0x1a:
6544  case 0x1b:
6545  case 0x1c:
6546  case 0x1d:
6547  case 0x1e:
6548  case 0x1f: {
6549  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation
6550  // (0..f)
6551  static const char hexify[16] = {'0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
6552  '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'};
6553 
6554  // print character c as \uxxxx
6555  for(const char m : {'u', '0', '0', hexify[c >> 4], hexify[c & 0x0f]}) {
6556  result[++pos] = m;
6557  }
6558 
6559  ++pos;
6560  break;
6561  }
6562 
6563  default: {
6564  // all other characters are added as-is
6565  result[pos++] = c;
6566  break;
6567  }
6568  }
6569  }
6570 
6571  assert(pos == s.size() + space);
6572  o->write_characters(result.c_str(), result.size());
6573  }
6574 
6584  template <typename NumberType, detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<NumberType, number_unsigned_t>::value or
6585  std::is_same<NumberType, number_integer_t>::value,
6586  int> = 0>
6587  void dump_integer(NumberType x) {
6588  // special case for "0"
6589  if(x == 0) {
6590  o->write_character('0');
6591  return;
6592  }
6593 
6594  const bool is_negative = x < 0;
6595  size_t i = 0;
6596 
6597  // spare 1 byte for '\0'
6598  while(x != 0 and i < number_buffer.size() - 1) {
6599  const auto digit = std::labs(static_cast<long>(x % 10));
6600  number_buffer[i++] = static_cast<char>('0' + digit);
6601  x /= 10;
6602  }
6603 
6604  // make sure the number has been processed completely
6605  assert(x == 0);
6606 
6607  if(is_negative) {
6608  // make sure there is capacity for the '-'
6609  assert(i < number_buffer.size() - 2);
6610  number_buffer[i++] = '-';
6611  }
6612 
6613  std::reverse(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + i);
6614  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), i);
6615  }
6616 
6625  void dump_float(number_float_t x) {
6626  // NaN / inf
6627  if(not std::isfinite(x) or std::isnan(x)) {
6628  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6629  return;
6630  }
6631 
6632  // special case for 0.0 and -0.0
6633  if(x == 0) {
6634  if(std::signbit(x)) {
6635  o->write_characters("-0.0", 4);
6636  }
6637  else {
6638  o->write_characters("0.0", 3);
6639  }
6640  return;
6641  }
6642 
6643  // get number of digits for a text -> float -> text round-trip
6644  static constexpr auto d = std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10;
6645 
6646  // the actual conversion
6647  std::ptrdiff_t len = snprintf(number_buffer.data(), number_buffer.size(), "%.*g", d, x);
6648 
6649  // negative value indicates an error
6650  assert(len > 0);
6651  // check if buffer was large enough
6652  assert(static_cast<size_t>(len) < number_buffer.size());
6653 
6654  // erase thousands separator
6655  if(thousands_sep != '\0') {
6656  const auto end = std::remove(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + len, thousands_sep);
6657  std::fill(end, number_buffer.end(), '\0');
6658  assert((end - number_buffer.begin()) <= len);
6659  len = (end - number_buffer.begin());
6660  }
6661 
6662  // convert decimal point to '.'
6663  if(decimal_point != '\0' and decimal_point != '.') {
6664  for(auto& c : number_buffer) {
6665  if(c == decimal_point) {
6666  c = '.';
6667  break;
6668  }
6669  }
6670  }
6671 
6672  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), static_cast<size_t>(len));
6673 
6674  // determine if need to append ".0"
6675  const bool value_is_int_like = std::none_of(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + len + 1,
6676  [](char c) { return c == '.' or c == 'e'; });
6677 
6678  if(value_is_int_like) {
6679  o->write_characters(".0", 2);
6680  }
6681  }
6682 
6683  private:
6685  output_adapter_t<char> o = nullptr;
6686 
6688  std::array<char, 64> number_buffer{{}};
6689 
6691  const std::lconv* loc = nullptr;
6693  const char thousands_sep = '\0';
6695  const char decimal_point = '\0';
6696 
6698  const char indent_char;
6699 
6701  string_t indent_string;
6702  };
6703 
6704  public:
6733  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j) {
6734  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
6735  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
6736  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
6737 
6738  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
6739  o.width(0);
6740 
6741  // do the actual serialization
6742  serializer s(output_adapter<char>::create(o), o.fill());
6743  s.dump(j, pretty_print, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
6744  return o;
6745  }
6746 
6754  JSON_DEPRECATED
6755  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o) {
6756  return o << j;
6757  }
6758 
6760 
6762  // deserialization //
6764 
6767 
6800  template <class T, std::size_t N>
6801  static basic_json parse(T (&array)[N], const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6802  // delegate the call to the iterator-range parse overload
6803  return parse(std::begin(array), std::end(array), cb);
6804  }
6805 
6837  template <typename CharT,
6838  typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
6839  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
6840  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
6841  int>::type = 0>
6842  static basic_json parse(const CharT s, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6843  return parser(input_adapter::create(s), cb).parse(true);
6844  }
6845 
6875  static basic_json parse(std::istream& i, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6876  return parser(input_adapter::create(i), cb).parse(true);
6877  }
6878 
6882  static basic_json parse(std::istream&& i, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6883  return parser(input_adapter::create(i), cb).parse(true);
6884  }
6885 
6931  template <
6932  class IteratorType,
6933  typename std::enable_if<std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
6934  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value,
6935  int>::type = 0>
6936  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6937  return parser(input_adapter::create(first, last), cb).parse(true);
6938  }
6939 
6984  template <class ContiguousContainer,
6985  typename std::enable_if<
6986  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
6987  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
6988  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(
6989  std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
6990  int>::type = 0>
6991  static basic_json parse(const ContiguousContainer& c, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr) {
6992  // delegate the call to the iterator-range parse overload
6993  return parse(std::begin(c), std::end(c), cb);
6994  }
6995 
7003  JSON_DEPRECATED
7004  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i) {
7005  j = parser(input_adapter::create(i)).parse(false);
7006  return i;
7007  }
7008 
7035  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j) {
7036  j = parser(input_adapter::create(i)).parse(false);
7037  return i;
7038  }
7039 
7041 
7043  // convenience functions //
7045 
7061  std::string type_name() const {
7062  {
7063  switch(m_type) {
7064  case value_t::null:
7065  return "null";
7066  case value_t::object:
7067  return "object";
7068  case value_t::array:
7069  return "array";
7070  case value_t::string:
7071  return "string";
7072  case value_t::boolean:
7073  return "boolean";
7074  case value_t::discarded:
7075  return "discarded";
7076  default:
7077  return "number";
7078  }
7079  }
7080  }
7081 
7082  private:
7084  // member variables //
7086 
7088  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
7089 
7091  json_value m_value = {};
7092 
7093  private:
7095  // iterators //
7097 
7107  class primitive_iterator_t {
7108  public:
7109  difference_type get_value() const noexcept {
7110  return m_it;
7111  }
7113  void set_begin() noexcept {
7114  m_it = begin_value;
7115  }
7116 
7118  void set_end() noexcept {
7119  m_it = end_value;
7120  }
7121 
7123  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept {
7124  return (m_it == begin_value);
7125  }
7126 
7128  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept {
7129  return (m_it == end_value);
7130  }
7131 
7132  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7133  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
7134  }
7135 
7136  friend constexpr bool operator!=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7137  return !(lhs == rhs);
7138  }
7139 
7140  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7141  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
7142  }
7143 
7144  friend constexpr bool operator<=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7145  return lhs.m_it <= rhs.m_it;
7146  }
7147 
7148  friend constexpr bool operator>(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7149  return lhs.m_it > rhs.m_it;
7150  }
7151 
7152  friend constexpr bool operator>=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7153  return lhs.m_it >= rhs.m_it;
7154  }
7155 
7156  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i) {
7157  auto result = *this;
7158  result += i;
7159  return result;
7160  }
7161 
7162  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept {
7163  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
7164  }
7165 
7166  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, primitive_iterator_t it) {
7167  return os << it.m_it;
7168  }
7169 
7170  primitive_iterator_t& operator++() {
7171  ++m_it;
7172  return *this;
7173  }
7174 
7175  primitive_iterator_t operator++(int) {
7176  auto result = *this;
7177  m_it++;
7178  return result;
7179  }
7180 
7181  primitive_iterator_t& operator--() {
7182  --m_it;
7183  return *this;
7184  }
7185 
7186  primitive_iterator_t operator--(int) {
7187  auto result = *this;
7188  m_it--;
7189  return result;
7190  }
7191 
7192  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n) {
7193  m_it += n;
7194  return *this;
7195  }
7196 
7197  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n) {
7198  m_it -= n;
7199  return *this;
7200  }
7201 
7202  private:
7203  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
7204  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
7205 
7207  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
7208  };
7209 
7217  struct internal_iterator {
7219  typename object_t::iterator object_iterator;
7221  typename array_t::iterator array_iterator;
7223  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator;
7224 
7226  internal_iterator() noexcept : object_iterator(), array_iterator(), primitive_iterator() {
7227  }
7228  };
7229 
7231  template <typename IteratorType>
7232  class iteration_proxy {
7233  private:
7235  class iteration_proxy_internal {
7236  private:
7238  IteratorType anchor;
7240  size_t array_index = 0;
7241 
7242  public:
7243  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it) {
7244  }
7245 
7247  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*() {
7248  return *this;
7249  }
7250 
7252  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++() {
7253  ++anchor;
7254  ++array_index;
7255 
7256  return *this;
7257  }
7258 
7260  bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const {
7261  return anchor != o.anchor;
7262  }
7263 
7265  typename basic_json::string_t key() const {
7266  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
7267 
7268  switch(anchor.m_object->type()) {
7269  // use integer array index as key
7270  case value_t::array: {
7271  return std::to_string(array_index);
7272  }
7273 
7274  // use key from the object
7275  case value_t::object: {
7276  return anchor.key();
7277  }
7278 
7279  // use an empty key for all primitive types
7280  default: {
7281  return "";
7282  }
7283  }
7284  }
7285 
7287  typename IteratorType::reference value() const {
7288  return anchor.value();
7289  }
7290  };
7291 
7293  typename IteratorType::reference container;
7294 
7295  public:
7297  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont) : container(cont) {
7298  }
7299 
7301  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept {
7302  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
7303  }
7304 
7306  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept {
7307  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
7308  }
7309  };
7310 
7311  public:
7331  template <typename U>
7332  class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, U> {
7334  friend class basic_json;
7335 
7336  // make sure U is basic_json or const basic_json
7337  static_assert(std::is_same<U, basic_json>::value or std::is_same<U, const basic_json>::value,
7338  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
7339 
7340  public:
7342  using value_type = typename basic_json::value_type;
7344  using difference_type = typename basic_json::difference_type;
7346  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value, typename basic_json::const_pointer,
7347  typename basic_json::pointer>::type;
7349  using reference = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value, typename basic_json::const_reference,
7350  typename basic_json::reference>::type;
7352  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
7353 
7355  iter_impl() = default;
7356 
7363  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object) {
7364  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7365 
7366  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7367  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7368  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
7369  break;
7370  }
7371 
7372  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7373  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
7374  break;
7375  }
7376 
7377  default: {
7378  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
7379  break;
7380  }
7381  }
7382  }
7383 
7384  /*
7385  Use operator `const_iterator` instead of `const_iterator(const iterator&
7386  other) noexcept` to avoid two class definitions for @ref iterator and
7387  @ref const_iterator.
7388 
7389  This function is only called if this class is an @ref iterator. If this
7390  class is a @ref const_iterator this function is not called.
7391  */
7392  operator const_iterator() const {
7393  const_iterator ret;
7394 
7395  if(m_object) {
7396  ret.m_object = m_object;
7397  ret.m_it = m_it;
7398  }
7399 
7400  return ret;
7401  }
7402 
7408  iter_impl(const iter_impl& other) noexcept : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {
7409  }
7410 
7416  iter_impl& operator=(iter_impl other) noexcept(
7417  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<pointer>::value and std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<pointer>::value and
7418  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<internal_iterator>::value and
7419  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<internal_iterator>::value) {
7420  std::swap(m_object, other.m_object);
7421  std::swap(m_it, other.m_it);
7422  return *this;
7423  }
7424 
7425  private:
7430  void set_begin() noexcept {
7431  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7432 
7433  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7434  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7435  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
7436  break;
7437  }
7438 
7439  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7440  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
7441  break;
7442  }
7443 
7444  case basic_json::value_t::null: {
7445  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
7446  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
7447  break;
7448  }
7449 
7450  default: {
7451  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
7452  break;
7453  }
7454  }
7455  }
7456 
7461  void set_end() noexcept {
7462  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7463 
7464  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7465  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7466  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
7467  break;
7468  }
7469 
7470  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7471  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
7472  break;
7473  }
7474 
7475  default: {
7476  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
7477  break;
7478  }
7479  }
7480  }
7481 
7482  public:
7487  reference operator*() const {
7488  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7489 
7490  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7491  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7492  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
7493  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
7494  }
7495 
7496  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7497  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
7498  return *m_it.array_iterator;
7499  }
7500 
7501  case basic_json::value_t::null: {
7502  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
7503  }
7504 
7505  default: {
7506  if(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()) {
7507  return *m_object;
7508  }
7509 
7510  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
7511  }
7512  }
7513  }
7514 
7519  pointer operator->() const {
7520  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7521 
7522  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7523  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7524  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
7525  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
7526  }
7527 
7528  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7529  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
7530  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
7531  }
7532 
7533  default: {
7534  if(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()) {
7535  return m_object;
7536  }
7537 
7538  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
7539  }
7540  }
7541  }
7542 
7547  iter_impl operator++(int) {
7548  auto result = *this;
7549  ++(*this);
7550  return result;
7551  }
7552 
7557  iter_impl& operator++() {
7558  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7559 
7560  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7561  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7562  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
7563  break;
7564  }
7565 
7566  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7567  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
7568  break;
7569  }
7570 
7571  default: {
7572  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
7573  break;
7574  }
7575  }
7576 
7577  return *this;
7578  }
7579 
7584  iter_impl operator--(int) {
7585  auto result = *this;
7586  --(*this);
7587  return result;
7588  }
7589 
7594  iter_impl& operator--() {
7595  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7596 
7597  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7598  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7599  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
7600  break;
7601  }
7602 
7603  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7604  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
7605  break;
7606  }
7607 
7608  default: {
7609  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
7610  break;
7611  }
7612  }
7613 
7614  return *this;
7615  }
7616 
7621  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const {
7622  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
7623  if(m_object != other.m_object) {
7624  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
7625  }
7626 
7627  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7628 
7629  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7630  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7631  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
7632  }
7633 
7634  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7635  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
7636  }
7637 
7638  default: {
7639  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
7640  }
7641  }
7642  }
7643 
7648  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const {
7649  return not operator==(other);
7650  }
7651 
7656  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const {
7657  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
7658  if(m_object != other.m_object) {
7659  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
7660  }
7661 
7662  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7663 
7664  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7665  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7666  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
7667  }
7668 
7669  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7670  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
7671  }
7672 
7673  default: {
7674  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
7675  }
7676  }
7677  }
7678 
7683  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const {
7684  return not other.operator<(*this);
7685  }
7686 
7691  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const {
7692  return not operator<=(other);
7693  }
7694 
7699  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const {
7700  return not operator<(other);
7701  }
7702 
7707  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i) {
7708  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7709 
7710  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7711  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7712  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
7713  }
7714 
7715  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7716  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
7717  break;
7718  }
7719 
7720  default: {
7721  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
7722  break;
7723  }
7724  }
7725 
7726  return *this;
7727  }
7728 
7733  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i) {
7734  return operator+=(-i);
7735  }
7736 
7741  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i) {
7742  auto result = *this;
7743  result += i;
7744  return result;
7745  }
7746 
7751  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i) {
7752  auto result = *this;
7753  result -= i;
7754  return result;
7755  }
7756 
7761  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const {
7762  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7763 
7764  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7765  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7766  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
7767  }
7768 
7769  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7770  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
7771  }
7772 
7773  default: {
7774  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
7775  }
7776  }
7777  }
7778 
7783  reference operator[](difference_type n) const {
7784  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7785 
7786  switch(m_object->m_type) {
7787  case basic_json::value_t::object: {
7788  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
7789  }
7790 
7791  case basic_json::value_t::array: {
7792  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
7793  }
7794 
7795  case basic_json::value_t::null: {
7796  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
7797  }
7798 
7799  default: {
7800  if(m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n) {
7801  return *m_object;
7802  }
7803 
7804  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
7805  }
7806  }
7807  }
7808 
7813  typename object_t::key_type key() const {
7814  assert(m_object != nullptr);
7815 
7816  if(m_object->is_object()) {
7817  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
7818  }
7819 
7820  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
7821  }
7822 
7827  reference value() const {
7828  return operator*();
7829  }
7830 
7831  private:
7833  pointer m_object = nullptr;
7835  internal_iterator m_it = internal_iterator();
7836  };
7837 
7855  template <typename Base>
7856  class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base> {
7857  public:
7859  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
7861  using reference = typename Base::reference;
7862 
7864  json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {
7865  }
7866 
7868  json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {
7869  }
7870 
7872  json_reverse_iterator operator++(int) {
7873  return base_iterator::operator++(1);
7874  }
7875 
7877  json_reverse_iterator& operator++() {
7878  base_iterator::operator++();
7879  return *this;
7880  }
7881 
7883  json_reverse_iterator operator--(int) {
7884  return base_iterator::operator--(1);
7885  }
7886 
7888  json_reverse_iterator& operator--() {
7889  base_iterator::operator--();
7890  return *this;
7891  }
7892 
7894  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i) {
7895  base_iterator::operator+=(i);
7896  return *this;
7897  }
7898 
7900  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const {
7901  auto result = *this;
7902  result += i;
7903  return result;
7904  }
7905 
7907  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const {
7908  auto result = *this;
7909  result -= i;
7910  return result;
7911  }
7912 
7914  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const {
7915  return this->base() - other.base();
7916  }
7917 
7919  reference operator[](difference_type n) const {
7920  return *(this->operator+(n));
7921  }
7922 
7924  typename object_t::key_type key() const {
7925  auto it = --this->base();
7926  return it.key();
7927  }
7928 
7930  reference value() const {
7931  auto it = --this->base();
7932  return it.operator*();
7933  }
7934  };
7935 
7936  private:
7938  // input adapters //
7940 
7942  class input_adapter {
7943  public:
7944  virtual int get_character() = 0;
7945  virtual std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) = 0;
7946  virtual ~input_adapter() {
7947  }
7948 
7949  // native support
7950 
7952  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(std::istream& i, const size_t buffer_size = 16384) {
7953  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new cached_input_stream_adapter(i, buffer_size));
7954  }
7955 
7957  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(std::istream&& i, const size_t buffer_size = 16384) {
7958  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new cached_input_stream_adapter(i, buffer_size));
7959  }
7960 
7962  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(const char* b, size_t l) {
7963  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new input_buffer_adapter(b, l));
7964  }
7965 
7966  // derived support
7967 
7969  template <typename CharT,
7970  typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
7971  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
7972  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
7973  int>::type = 0>
7974  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(CharT b) {
7975  return create(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b)));
7976  }
7977 
7979  template <class IteratorType,
7980  typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category,
7981  std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
7982  int>::type = 0>
7983  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(IteratorType first, IteratorType last) {
7984  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
7985  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
7986  assert(std::accumulate(first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
7987  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val) {
7988  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
7989  return res;
7990  })
7991  .first);
7992 
7993  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
7994  static_assert(sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
7995  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
7996 
7997  return create(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last)));
7998  }
7999 
8001  template <class T, std::size_t N>
8002  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(T (&array)[N]) {
8003  // delegate the call to the iterator-range overload
8004  return create(std::begin(array), std::end(array));
8005  }
8006 
8008  template <class ContiguousContainer,
8009  typename std::enable_if<
8010  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
8011  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
8012  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(
8013  std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
8014  int>::type = 0>
8015  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(const ContiguousContainer& c) {
8016  // delegate the call to the iterator-range overload
8017  return create(std::begin(c), std::end(c));
8018  }
8019  };
8020 
8022  using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>;
8023 
8025  class cached_input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter {
8026  public:
8027  cached_input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i, const size_t buffer_size)
8028  : is(i), start_position(is.tellg()), buffer(buffer_size, '\0') {
8029  // immediately abort if stream is erroneous
8030  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(i.fail())) {
8031  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(111, 0, "bad input stream"));
8032  }
8033 
8034  // initial fill
8035  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
8036  // store number of bytes in the buffer
8037  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
8038 
8039  // skip byte-order mark
8040  if(fill_size >= 3 and buffer[0] == '\xEF' and buffer[1] == '\xBB' and buffer[2] == '\xBF') {
8041  buffer_pos += 3;
8042  processed_chars += 3;
8043  }
8044  }
8045 
8046  ~cached_input_stream_adapter() override {
8047  // clear stream flags
8048  is.clear();
8049  // We initially read a lot of characters into the buffer, and we
8050  // may not have processed all of them. Therefore, we need to
8051  // "rewind" the stream after the last processed char.
8052  is.seekg(start_position + static_cast<std::streamoff>(processed_chars));
8053  // clear stream flags
8054  is.clear();
8055  }
8056 
8057  int get_character() override {
8058  // check if refilling is necessary and possible
8059  if(buffer_pos == fill_size and not eof) {
8060  // refill
8061  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
8062  // store number of bytes in the buffer
8063  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
8064 
8065  // the buffer is ready
8066  buffer_pos = 0;
8067 
8068  // remember that filling did not yield new input
8069  if(fill_size == 0) {
8070  eof = true;
8071  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8072  }
8073  }
8074 
8075  ++processed_chars;
8076  return buffer[buffer_pos++] & 0xFF;
8077  ;
8078  }
8079 
8080  std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) override {
8081  // create buffer
8082  std::string result(length, '\0');
8083 
8084  // save stream position
8085  auto current_pos = is.tellg();
8086  // save stream flags
8087  auto flags = is.rdstate();
8088 
8089  // clear stream flags
8090  is.clear();
8091  // set stream position
8092  is.seekg(static_cast<std::streamoff>(offset));
8093  // read bytes
8094  is.read(&result[0], static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
8095 
8096  // reset stream position
8097  is.seekg(current_pos);
8098  // reset stream flags
8099  is.setstate(flags);
8100 
8101  return result;
8102  }
8103 
8104  private:
8106  std::istream& is;
8107 
8109  size_t processed_chars = 0;
8111  size_t buffer_pos = 0;
8112 
8114  bool eof = false;
8116  size_t fill_size = 0;
8117 
8119  const std::streampos start_position;
8120 
8122  std::vector<char> buffer;
8123  };
8124 
8126  class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter {
8127  public:
8128  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, size_t l) : input_adapter(), cursor(b), limit(b + l), start(b) {
8129  }
8130 
8131  // delete because of pointer members
8132  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
8133  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
8134 
8135  int get_character() override {
8136  if(JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit)) {
8137  return *(cursor++) & 0xFF;
8138  }
8139  else {
8140  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8141  }
8142  }
8143 
8144  std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) override {
8145  // avoid reading too many characters
8146  const size_t max_length = static_cast<size_t>(limit - start);
8147  return std::string(start + offset, std::min(length, max_length - offset));
8148  }
8149 
8150  private:
8152  const char* cursor;
8154  const char* limit;
8156  const char* start;
8157  };
8158 
8160  // binary serialization/deserialization //
8162 
8165 
8166  private:
8170  class binary_reader {
8171  public:
8177  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(adapter), is_little_endian(little_endianess()) {
8178  assert(ia);
8179  }
8180 
8193  basic_json parse_cbor(const bool get_char = true) {
8194  switch(get_char ? get() : current) {
8195  // EOF
8196  case std::char_traits<char>::eof(): {
8197  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
8198  }
8199 
8200  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
8201  case 0x00:
8202  case 0x01:
8203  case 0x02:
8204  case 0x03:
8205  case 0x04:
8206  case 0x05:
8207  case 0x06:
8208  case 0x07:
8209  case 0x08:
8210  case 0x09:
8211  case 0x0a:
8212  case 0x0b:
8213  case 0x0c:
8214  case 0x0d:
8215  case 0x0e:
8216  case 0x0f:
8217  case 0x10:
8218  case 0x11:
8219  case 0x12:
8220  case 0x13:
8221  case 0x14:
8222  case 0x15:
8223  case 0x16:
8224  case 0x17: {
8225  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
8226  }
8227 
8228  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
8229  {
8230  return get_number<uint8_t>();
8231  }
8232 
8233  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
8234  {
8235  return get_number<uint16_t>();
8236  }
8237 
8238  case 0x1a: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
8239  {
8240  return get_number<uint32_t>();
8241  }
8242 
8243  case 0x1b: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
8244  {
8245  return get_number<uint64_t>();
8246  }
8247 
8248  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
8249  case 0x20:
8250  case 0x21:
8251  case 0x22:
8252  case 0x23:
8253  case 0x24:
8254  case 0x25:
8255  case 0x26:
8256  case 0x27:
8257  case 0x28:
8258  case 0x29:
8259  case 0x2a:
8260  case 0x2b:
8261  case 0x2c:
8262  case 0x2d:
8263  case 0x2e:
8264  case 0x2f:
8265  case 0x30:
8266  case 0x31:
8267  case 0x32:
8268  case 0x33:
8269  case 0x34:
8270  case 0x35:
8271  case 0x36:
8272  case 0x37: {
8273  return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current);
8274  }
8275 
8276  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
8277  {
8278  // must be uint8_t !
8279  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint8_t>();
8280  }
8281 
8282  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
8283  {
8284  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint16_t>();
8285  }
8286 
8287  case 0x3a: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
8288  {
8289  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint32_t>();
8290  }
8291 
8292  case 0x3b: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
8293  {
8294  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
8295  }
8296 
8297  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
8298  case 0x60:
8299  case 0x61:
8300  case 0x62:
8301  case 0x63:
8302  case 0x64:
8303  case 0x65:
8304  case 0x66:
8305  case 0x67:
8306  case 0x68:
8307  case 0x69:
8308  case 0x6a:
8309  case 0x6b:
8310  case 0x6c:
8311  case 0x6d:
8312  case 0x6e:
8313  case 0x6f:
8314  case 0x70:
8315  case 0x71:
8316  case 0x72:
8317  case 0x73:
8318  case 0x74:
8319  case 0x75:
8320  case 0x76:
8321  case 0x77:
8322  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
8323  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
8324  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
8325  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
8326  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
8327  {
8328  return get_cbor_string();
8329  }
8330 
8331  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
8332  case 0x80:
8333  case 0x81:
8334  case 0x82:
8335  case 0x83:
8336  case 0x84:
8337  case 0x85:
8338  case 0x86:
8339  case 0x87:
8340  case 0x88:
8341  case 0x89:
8342  case 0x8a:
8343  case 0x8b:
8344  case 0x8c:
8345  case 0x8d:
8346  case 0x8e:
8347  case 0x8f:
8348  case 0x90:
8349  case 0x91:
8350  case 0x92:
8351  case 0x93:
8352  case 0x94:
8353  case 0x95:
8354  case 0x96:
8355  case 0x97: {
8356  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8357  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
8358  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8359  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
8360  }
8361  return result;
8362  }
8363 
8364  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
8365  {
8366  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8367  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
8368  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8369  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
8370  }
8371  return result;
8372  }
8373 
8374  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
8375  {
8376  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8377  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
8378  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8379  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
8380  }
8381  return result;
8382  }
8383 
8384  case 0x9a: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
8385  {
8386  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8387  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
8388  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8389  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
8390  }
8391  return result;
8392  }
8393 
8394  case 0x9b: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
8395  {
8396  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8397  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
8398  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8399  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
8400  }
8401  return result;
8402  }
8403 
8404  case 0x9f: // array (indefinite length)
8405  {
8406  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8407  while(get() != 0xff) {
8408  result.push_back(parse_cbor(false));
8409  }
8410  return result;
8411  }
8412 
8413  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
8414  case 0xa0:
8415  case 0xa1:
8416  case 0xa2:
8417  case 0xa3:
8418  case 0xa4:
8419  case 0xa5:
8420  case 0xa6:
8421  case 0xa7:
8422  case 0xa8:
8423  case 0xa9:
8424  case 0xaa:
8425  case 0xab:
8426  case 0xac:
8427  case 0xad:
8428  case 0xae:
8429  case 0xaf:
8430  case 0xb0:
8431  case 0xb1:
8432  case 0xb2:
8433  case 0xb3:
8434  case 0xb4:
8435  case 0xb5:
8436  case 0xb6:
8437  case 0xb7: {
8438  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8439  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
8440  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8441  get();
8442  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8443  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8444  }
8445  return result;
8446  }
8447 
8448  case 0xb8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
8449  {
8450  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8451  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
8452  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8453  get();
8454  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8455  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8456  }
8457  return result;
8458  }
8459 
8460  case 0xb9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
8461  {
8462  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8463  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
8464  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8465  get();
8466  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8467  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8468  }
8469  return result;
8470  }
8471 
8472  case 0xba: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
8473  {
8474  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8475  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
8476  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8477  get();
8478  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8479  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8480  }
8481  return result;
8482  }
8483 
8484  case 0xbb: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
8485  {
8486  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8487  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
8488  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8489  get();
8490  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8491  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8492  }
8493  return result;
8494  }
8495 
8496  case 0xbf: // map (indefinite length)
8497  {
8498  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8499  while(get() != 0xff) {
8500  auto key = get_cbor_string();
8501  result[key] = parse_cbor();
8502  }
8503  return result;
8504  }
8505 
8506  case 0xf4: // false
8507  {
8508  return false;
8509  }
8510 
8511  case 0xf5: // true
8512  {
8513  return true;
8514  }
8515 
8516  case 0xf6: // null
8517  {
8518  return value_t::null;
8519  }
8520 
8521  case 0xf9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
8522  {
8523  const int byte1 = get();
8524  check_eof();
8525  const int byte2 = get();
8526  check_eof();
8527 
8528  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
8529  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
8530  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
8531  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
8532  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
8533  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
8534  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
8535  // is shown in Fig. 3.
8536  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
8537  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1f;
8538  const int mant = half & 0x3ff;
8539  double val;
8540  if(exp == 0) {
8541  val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
8542  }
8543  else if(exp != 31) {
8544  val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
8545  }
8546  else {
8547  val = mant == 0 ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
8548  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
8549  }
8550  return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
8551  }
8552 
8553  case 0xfa: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
8554  {
8555  return get_number<float>();
8556  }
8557 
8558  case 0xfb: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
8559  {
8560  return get_number<double>();
8561  }
8562 
8563  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
8564  {
8565  std::stringstream ss;
8566  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
8567  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading CBOR; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
8568  }
8569  }
8570  }
8571 
8580  basic_json parse_msgpack() {
8581  switch(get()) {
8582  // EOF
8583  case std::char_traits<char>::eof(): {
8584  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
8585  }
8586 
8587  // positive fixint
8588  case 0x00:
8589  case 0x01:
8590  case 0x02:
8591  case 0x03:
8592  case 0x04:
8593  case 0x05:
8594  case 0x06:
8595  case 0x07:
8596  case 0x08:
8597  case 0x09:
8598  case 0x0a:
8599  case 0x0b:
8600  case 0x0c:
8601  case 0x0d:
8602  case 0x0e:
8603  case 0x0f:
8604  case 0x10:
8605  case 0x11:
8606  case 0x12:
8607  case 0x13:
8608  case 0x14:
8609  case 0x15:
8610  case 0x16:
8611  case 0x17:
8612  case 0x18:
8613  case 0x19:
8614  case 0x1a:
8615  case 0x1b:
8616  case 0x1c:
8617  case 0x1d:
8618  case 0x1e:
8619  case 0x1f:
8620  case 0x20:
8621  case 0x21:
8622  case 0x22:
8623  case 0x23:
8624  case 0x24:
8625  case 0x25:
8626  case 0x26:
8627  case 0x27:
8628  case 0x28:
8629  case 0x29:
8630  case 0x2a:
8631  case 0x2b:
8632  case 0x2c:
8633  case 0x2d:
8634  case 0x2e:
8635  case 0x2f:
8636  case 0x30:
8637  case 0x31:
8638  case 0x32:
8639  case 0x33:
8640  case 0x34:
8641  case 0x35:
8642  case 0x36:
8643  case 0x37:
8644  case 0x38:
8645  case 0x39:
8646  case 0x3a:
8647  case 0x3b:
8648  case 0x3c:
8649  case 0x3d:
8650  case 0x3e:
8651  case 0x3f:
8652  case 0x40:
8653  case 0x41:
8654  case 0x42:
8655  case 0x43:
8656  case 0x44:
8657  case 0x45:
8658  case 0x46:
8659  case 0x47:
8660  case 0x48:
8661  case 0x49:
8662  case 0x4a:
8663  case 0x4b:
8664  case 0x4c:
8665  case 0x4d:
8666  case 0x4e:
8667  case 0x4f:
8668  case 0x50:
8669  case 0x51:
8670  case 0x52:
8671  case 0x53:
8672  case 0x54:
8673  case 0x55:
8674  case 0x56:
8675  case 0x57:
8676  case 0x58:
8677  case 0x59:
8678  case 0x5a:
8679  case 0x5b:
8680  case 0x5c:
8681  case 0x5d:
8682  case 0x5e:
8683  case 0x5f:
8684  case 0x60:
8685  case 0x61:
8686  case 0x62:
8687  case 0x63:
8688  case 0x64:
8689  case 0x65:
8690  case 0x66:
8691  case 0x67:
8692  case 0x68:
8693  case 0x69:
8694  case 0x6a:
8695  case 0x6b:
8696  case 0x6c:
8697  case 0x6d:
8698  case 0x6e:
8699  case 0x6f:
8700  case 0x70:
8701  case 0x71:
8702  case 0x72:
8703  case 0x73:
8704  case 0x74:
8705  case 0x75:
8706  case 0x76:
8707  case 0x77:
8708  case 0x78:
8709  case 0x79:
8710  case 0x7a:
8711  case 0x7b:
8712  case 0x7c:
8713  case 0x7d:
8714  case 0x7e:
8715  case 0x7f: {
8716  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
8717  }
8718 
8719  // fixmap
8720  case 0x80:
8721  case 0x81:
8722  case 0x82:
8723  case 0x83:
8724  case 0x84:
8725  case 0x85:
8726  case 0x86:
8727  case 0x87:
8728  case 0x88:
8729  case 0x89:
8730  case 0x8a:
8731  case 0x8b:
8732  case 0x8c:
8733  case 0x8d:
8734  case 0x8e:
8735  case 0x8f: {
8736  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8737  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
8738  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8739  get();
8740  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
8741  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
8742  }
8743  return result;
8744  }
8745 
8746  // fixarray
8747  case 0x90:
8748  case 0x91:
8749  case 0x92:
8750  case 0x93:
8751  case 0x94:
8752  case 0x95:
8753  case 0x96:
8754  case 0x97:
8755  case 0x98:
8756  case 0x99:
8757  case 0x9a:
8758  case 0x9b:
8759  case 0x9c:
8760  case 0x9d:
8761  case 0x9e:
8762  case 0x9f: {
8763  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8764  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
8765  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8766  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
8767  }
8768  return result;
8769  }
8770 
8771  // fixstr
8772  case 0xa0:
8773  case 0xa1:
8774  case 0xa2:
8775  case 0xa3:
8776  case 0xa4:
8777  case 0xa5:
8778  case 0xa6:
8779  case 0xa7:
8780  case 0xa8:
8781  case 0xa9:
8782  case 0xaa:
8783  case 0xab:
8784  case 0xac:
8785  case 0xad:
8786  case 0xae:
8787  case 0xaf:
8788  case 0xb0:
8789  case 0xb1:
8790  case 0xb2:
8791  case 0xb3:
8792  case 0xb4:
8793  case 0xb5:
8794  case 0xb6:
8795  case 0xb7:
8796  case 0xb8:
8797  case 0xb9:
8798  case 0xba:
8799  case 0xbb:
8800  case 0xbc:
8801  case 0xbd:
8802  case 0xbe:
8803  case 0xbf: {
8804  return get_msgpack_string();
8805  }
8806 
8807  case 0xc0: // nil
8808  {
8809  return value_t::null;
8810  }
8811 
8812  case 0xc2: // false
8813  {
8814  return false;
8815  }
8816 
8817  case 0xc3: // true
8818  {
8819  return true;
8820  }
8821 
8822  case 0xca: // float 32
8823  {
8824  return get_number<float>();
8825  }
8826 
8827  case 0xcb: // float 64
8828  {
8829  return get_number<double>();
8830  }
8831 
8832  case 0xcc: // uint 8
8833  {
8834  return get_number<uint8_t>();
8835  }
8836 
8837  case 0xcd: // uint 16
8838  {
8839  return get_number<uint16_t>();
8840  }
8841 
8842  case 0xce: // uint 32
8843  {
8844  return get_number<uint32_t>();
8845  }
8846 
8847  case 0xcf: // uint 64
8848  {
8849  return get_number<uint64_t>();
8850  }
8851 
8852  case 0xd0: // int 8
8853  {
8854  return get_number<int8_t>();
8855  }
8856 
8857  case 0xd1: // int 16
8858  {
8859  return get_number<int16_t>();
8860  }
8861 
8862  case 0xd2: // int 32
8863  {
8864  return get_number<int32_t>();
8865  }
8866 
8867  case 0xd3: // int 64
8868  {
8869  return get_number<int64_t>();
8870  }
8871 
8872  case 0xd9: // str 8
8873  case 0xda: // str 16
8874  case 0xdb: // str 32
8875  {
8876  return get_msgpack_string();
8877  }
8878 
8879  case 0xdc: // array 16
8880  {
8881  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8882  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
8883  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8884  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
8885  }
8886  return result;
8887  }
8888 
8889  case 0xdd: // array 32
8890  {
8891  basic_json result = value_t::array;
8892  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
8893  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8894  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
8895  }
8896  return result;
8897  }
8898 
8899  case 0xde: // map 16
8900  {
8901  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8902  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
8903  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8904  get();
8905  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
8906  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
8907  }
8908  return result;
8909  }
8910 
8911  case 0xdf: // map 32
8912  {
8913  basic_json result = value_t::object;
8914  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
8915  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
8916  get();
8917  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
8918  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
8919  }
8920  return result;
8921  }
8922 
8923  // positive fixint
8924  case 0xe0:
8925  case 0xe1:
8926  case 0xe2:
8927  case 0xe3:
8928  case 0xe4:
8929  case 0xe5:
8930  case 0xe6:
8931  case 0xe7:
8932  case 0xe8:
8933  case 0xe9:
8934  case 0xea:
8935  case 0xeb:
8936  case 0xec:
8937  case 0xed:
8938  case 0xee:
8939  case 0xef:
8940  case 0xf0:
8941  case 0xf1:
8942  case 0xf2:
8943  case 0xf3:
8944  case 0xf4:
8945  case 0xf5:
8946  case 0xf6:
8947  case 0xf7:
8948  case 0xf8:
8949  case 0xf9:
8950  case 0xfa:
8951  case 0xfb:
8952  case 0xfc:
8953  case 0xfd:
8954  case 0xfe:
8955  case 0xff: {
8956  return static_cast<int8_t>(current);
8957  }
8958 
8959  default: // anything else
8960  {
8961  std::stringstream ss;
8962  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
8963  JSON_THROW(
8964  parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading MessagePack; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
8965  }
8966  }
8967  }
8968 
8976  static bool little_endianess() noexcept {
8977  int num = 1;
8978  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
8979  }
8980 
8981  private:
8991  int get() {
8992  ++chars_read;
8993  return (current = ia->get_character());
8994  }
8995 
8996  /*
8997  @brief read a number from the input
8998 
8999  @tparam T the type of the number
9000 
9001  @return number of type @a T
9002 
9003  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
9004  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
9005  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
9006 
9007  @throw parse_error.110 if input has less than `sizeof(T)` bytes
9008  */
9009  template <typename T>
9010  T get_number() {
9011  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
9012  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(T)> vec;
9013  for(size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(T); ++i) {
9014  get();
9015  check_eof();
9016 
9017  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
9018  if(is_little_endian) {
9019  vec[sizeof(T) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
9020  }
9021  else {
9022  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
9023  }
9024  }
9025 
9026  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
9027  T result;
9028  std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(T));
9029  return result;
9030  }
9031 
9041  std::string get_string(const size_t len) {
9042  std::string result;
9043  for(size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
9044  get();
9045  check_eof();
9046  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
9047  }
9048  return result;
9049  }
9050 
9063  std::string get_cbor_string() {
9064  check_eof();
9065 
9066  switch(current) {
9067  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
9068  case 0x60:
9069  case 0x61:
9070  case 0x62:
9071  case 0x63:
9072  case 0x64:
9073  case 0x65:
9074  case 0x66:
9075  case 0x67:
9076  case 0x68:
9077  case 0x69:
9078  case 0x6a:
9079  case 0x6b:
9080  case 0x6c:
9081  case 0x6d:
9082  case 0x6e:
9083  case 0x6f:
9084  case 0x70:
9085  case 0x71:
9086  case 0x72:
9087  case 0x73:
9088  case 0x74:
9089  case 0x75:
9090  case 0x76:
9091  case 0x77: {
9092  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
9093  return get_string(len);
9094  }
9095 
9096  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
9097  {
9098  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
9099  return get_string(len);
9100  }
9101 
9102  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
9103  {
9104  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9105  return get_string(len);
9106  }
9107 
9108  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
9109  {
9110  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9111  return get_string(len);
9112  }
9113 
9114  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
9115  {
9116  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
9117  return get_string(len);
9118  }
9119 
9120  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
9121  {
9122  std::string result;
9123  while(get() != 0xff) {
9124  check_eof();
9125  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
9126  }
9127  return result;
9128  }
9129 
9130  default: {
9131  std::stringstream ss;
9132  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
9133  JSON_THROW(
9134  parse_error::create(113, chars_read, "expected a CBOR string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
9135  }
9136  }
9137  }
9138 
9150  std::string get_msgpack_string() {
9151  check_eof();
9152 
9153  switch(current) {
9154  // fixstr
9155  case 0xa0:
9156  case 0xa1:
9157  case 0xa2:
9158  case 0xa3:
9159  case 0xa4:
9160  case 0xa5:
9161  case 0xa6:
9162  case 0xa7:
9163  case 0xa8:
9164  case 0xa9:
9165  case 0xaa:
9166  case 0xab:
9167  case 0xac:
9168  case 0xad:
9169  case 0xae:
9170  case 0xaf:
9171  case 0xb0:
9172  case 0xb1:
9173  case 0xb2:
9174  case 0xb3:
9175  case 0xb4:
9176  case 0xb5:
9177  case 0xb6:
9178  case 0xb7:
9179  case 0xb8:
9180  case 0xb9:
9181  case 0xba:
9182  case 0xbb:
9183  case 0xbc:
9184  case 0xbd:
9185  case 0xbe:
9186  case 0xbf: {
9187  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
9188  return get_string(len);
9189  }
9190 
9191  case 0xd9: // str 8
9192  {
9193  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
9194  return get_string(len);
9195  }
9196 
9197  case 0xda: // str 16
9198  {
9199  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9200  return get_string(len);
9201  }
9202 
9203  case 0xdb: // str 32
9204  {
9205  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9206  return get_string(len);
9207  }
9208 
9209  default: {
9210  std::stringstream ss;
9211  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
9212  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read,
9213  "expected a MessagePack string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
9214  }
9215  }
9216  }
9217 
9222  void check_eof() const {
9223  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof())) {
9224  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
9225  }
9226  }
9227 
9228  private:
9230  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
9231 
9233  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
9234 
9236  size_t chars_read = 0;
9237 
9239  const bool is_little_endian = true;
9240  };
9241 
9245  class binary_writer {
9246  public:
9252  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<uint8_t> adapter)
9253  : is_little_endian(binary_reader::little_endianess()), oa(adapter) {
9254  assert(oa);
9255  }
9256 
9260  void write_cbor(const basic_json& j) {
9261  switch(j.type()) {
9262  case value_t::null: {
9263  oa->write_character(0xf6);
9264  break;
9265  }
9266 
9267  case value_t::boolean: {
9268  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xf5 : 0xf4);
9269  break;
9270  }
9271 
9272  case value_t::number_integer: {
9273  if(j.m_value.number_integer >= 0) {
9274  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
9275  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
9276  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
9277  if(j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17) {
9278  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9279  }
9280  else if(j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()) {
9281  oa->write_character(0x18);
9282  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9283  }
9284  else if(j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)()) {
9285  oa->write_character(0x19);
9286  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9287  }
9288  else if(j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)()) {
9289  oa->write_character(0x1a);
9290  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9291  }
9292  else {
9293  oa->write_character(0x1b);
9294  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9295  }
9296  }
9297  else {
9298  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
9299  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
9300  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
9301  if(j.m_value.number_integer >= -24) {
9302  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
9303  }
9304  else if(positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()) {
9305  oa->write_character(0x38);
9306  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
9307  }
9308  else if(positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)()) {
9309  oa->write_character(0x39);
9310  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
9311  }
9312  else if(positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)()) {
9313  oa->write_character(0x3a);
9314  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
9315  }
9316  else {
9317  oa->write_character(0x3b);
9318  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
9319  }
9320  }
9321  break;
9322  }
9323 
9324  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
9325  if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17) {
9326  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
9327  }
9328  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()) {
9329  oa->write_character(0x18);
9330  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
9331  }
9332  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)()) {
9333  oa->write_character(0x19);
9334  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
9335  }
9336  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)()) {
9337  oa->write_character(0x1a);
9338  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
9339  }
9340  else {
9341  oa->write_character(0x1b);
9342  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
9343  }
9344  break;
9345  }
9346 
9347  case value_t::number_float: {
9348  // Double-Precision Float
9349  oa->write_character(0xfb);
9350  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
9351  break;
9352  }
9353 
9354  case value_t::string: {
9355  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
9356  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
9357  if(N <= 0x17) {
9358  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
9359  }
9360  else if(N <= 0xff) {
9361  oa->write_character(0x78);
9362  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
9363  }
9364  else if(N <= 0xffff) {
9365  oa->write_character(0x79);
9366  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9367  }
9368  else if(N <= 0xffffffff) {
9369  oa->write_character(0x7a);
9370  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9371  }
9372  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9373  else if(N <= 0xffffffffffffffff) {
9374  oa->write_character(0x7b);
9375  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
9376  }
9377  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9378 
9379  // step 2: write the string
9380  oa->write_characters(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
9381  j.m_value.string->size());
9382  break;
9383  }
9384 
9385  case value_t::array: {
9386  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
9387  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
9388  if(N <= 0x17) {
9389  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
9390  }
9391  else if(N <= 0xff) {
9392  oa->write_character(0x98);
9393  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
9394  }
9395  else if(N <= 0xffff) {
9396  oa->write_character(0x99);
