9397  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9398  }
9399  else if(N <= 0xffffffff) {
9400  oa->write_character(0x9a);
9401  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9402  }
9403  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9404  else if(N <= 0xffffffffffffffff) {
9405  oa->write_character(0x9b);
9406  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
9407  }
9408  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9409 
9410  // step 2: write each element
9411  for(const auto& el : *j.m_value.array) {
9412  write_cbor(el);
9413  }
9414  break;
9415  }
9416 
9417  case value_t::object: {
9418  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
9419  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
9420  if(N <= 0x17) {
9421  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 + N));
9422  }
9423  else if(N <= 0xff) {
9424  oa->write_character(0xb8);
9425  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
9426  }
9427  else if(N <= 0xffff) {
9428  oa->write_character(0xb9);
9429  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9430  }
9431  else if(N <= 0xffffffff) {
9432  oa->write_character(0xba);
9433  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9434  }
9435  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9436  else if(N <= 0xffffffffffffffff) {
9437  oa->write_character(0xbb);
9438  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
9439  }
9440  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9441 
9442  // step 2: write each element
9443  for(const auto& el : *j.m_value.object) {
9444  write_cbor(el.first);
9445  write_cbor(el.second);
9446  }
9447  break;
9448  }
9449 
9450  default: {
9451  break;
9452  }
9453  }
9454  }
9455 
9459  void write_msgpack(const basic_json& j) {
9460  switch(j.type()) {
9461  case value_t::null: {
9462  // nil
9463  oa->write_character(0xc0);
9464  break;
9465  }
9466 
9467  case value_t::boolean: {
9468  // true and false
9469  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xc3 : 0xc2);
9470  break;
9471  }
9472 
9473  case value_t::number_integer: {
9474  if(j.m_value.number_integer >= 0) {
9475  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
9476  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we
9477  // used the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case
9478  // here.
9479  if(j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128) {
9480  // positive fixnum
9481  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9482  }
9483  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()) {
9484  // uint 8
9485  oa->write_character(0xcc);
9486  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9487  }
9488  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)()) {
9489  // uint 16
9490  oa->write_character(0xcd);
9491  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9492  }
9493  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)()) {
9494  // uint 32
9495  oa->write_character(0xce);
9496  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9497  }
9498  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)()) {
9499  // uint 64
9500  oa->write_character(0xcf);
9501  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9502  }
9503  }
9504  else {
9505  if(j.m_value.number_integer >= -32) {
9506  // negative fixnum
9507  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9508  }
9509  else if(j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and
9510  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)()) {
9511  // int 8
9512  oa->write_character(0xd0);
9513  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9514  }
9515  else if(j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and
9516  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)()) {
9517  // int 16
9518  oa->write_character(0xd1);
9519  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9520  }
9521  else if(j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and
9522  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)()) {
9523  // int 32
9524  oa->write_character(0xd2);
9525  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9526  }
9527  else if(j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and
9528  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)()) {
9529  // int 64
9530  oa->write_character(0xd3);
9531  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9532  }
9533  }
9534  break;
9535  }
9536 
9537  case value_t::number_unsigned: {
9538  if(j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128) {
9539  // positive fixnum
9540  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9541  }
9542  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()) {
9543  // uint 8
9544  oa->write_character(0xcc);
9545  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9546  }
9547  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)()) {
9548  // uint 16
9549  oa->write_character(0xcd);
9550  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9551  }
9552  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)()) {
9553  // uint 32
9554  oa->write_character(0xce);
9555  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9556  }
9557  else if(j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)()) {
9558  // uint 64
9559  oa->write_character(0xcf);
9560  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
9561  }
9562  break;
9563  }
9564 
9565  case value_t::number_float: {
9566  // float 64
9567  oa->write_character(0xcb);
9568  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
9569  break;
9570  }
9571 
9572  case value_t::string: {
9573  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
9574  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
9575  if(N <= 31) {
9576  // fixstr
9577  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 | N));
9578  }
9579  else if(N <= 255) {
9580  // str 8
9581  oa->write_character(0xd9);
9582  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
9583  }
9584  else if(N <= 65535) {
9585  // str 16
9586  oa->write_character(0xda);
9587  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9588  }
9589  else if(N <= 4294967295) {
9590  // str 32
9591  oa->write_character(0xdb);
9592  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9593  }
9594 
9595  // step 2: write the string
9596  oa->write_characters(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
9597  j.m_value.string->size());
9598  break;
9599  }
9600 
9601  case value_t::array: {
9602  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
9603  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
9604  if(N <= 15) {
9605  // fixarray
9606  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
9607  }
9608  else if(N <= 0xffff) {
9609  // array 16
9610  oa->write_character(0xdc);
9611  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9612  }
9613  else if(N <= 0xffffffff) {
9614  // array 32
9615  oa->write_character(0xdd);
9616  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9617  }
9618 
9619  // step 2: write each element
9620  for(const auto& el : *j.m_value.array) {
9621  write_msgpack(el);
9622  }
9623  break;
9624  }
9625 
9626  case value_t::object: {
9627  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
9628  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
9629  if(N <= 15) {
9630  // fixmap
9631  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xf)));
9632  }
9633  else if(N <= 65535) {
9634  // map 16
9635  oa->write_character(0xde);
9636  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
9637  }
9638  else if(N <= 4294967295) {
9639  // map 32
9640  oa->write_character(0xdf);
9641  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
9642  }
9643 
9644  // step 2: write each element
9645  for(const auto& el : *j.m_value.object) {
9646  write_msgpack(el.first);
9647  write_msgpack(el.second);
9648  }
9649  break;
9650  }
9651 
9652  default: {
9653  break;
9654  }
9655  }
9656  }
9657 
9658  private:
9659  /*
9660  @brief write a number to output input
9661 
9662  @param[in] n number of type @a T
9663  @tparam T the type of the number
9664 
9665  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
9666  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
9667  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
9668  */
9669  template <typename T>
9670  void write_number(T n) {
9671  // step 1: write number to array of length T
9672  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(T)> vec;
9673  std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(T));
9674 
9675  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
9676  for(size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(T); ++i) {
9677  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
9678  if(is_little_endian) {
9679  oa->write_character(vec[sizeof(T) - i - 1]);
9680  }
9681  else {
9682  oa->write_character(vec[i]);
9683  }
9684  }
9685  }
9686 
9687  private:
9689  const bool is_little_endian = true;
9690 
9692  output_adapter_t<uint8_t> oa = nullptr;
9693  };
9694 
9695  public:
9778  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j) {
9779  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
9780  binary_writer bw(output_adapter<uint8_t>::create(result));
9781  bw.write_cbor(j);
9782  return result;
9783  }
9784 
9859  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j) {
9860  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
9861  binary_writer bw(output_adapter<uint8_t>::create(result));
9862  bw.write_msgpack(j);
9863  return result;
9864  }
9865 
9953  static basic_json from_cbor(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v, const size_t start_index = 0) {
9954  binary_reader br(input_adapter::create(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
9955  return br.parse_cbor();
9956  }
9957 
10025  static basic_json from_msgpack(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v, const size_t start_index = 0) {
10026  binary_reader br(input_adapter::create(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
10027  return br.parse_msgpack();
10028  }
10029 
10031 
10033  // lexer and parser //
10035 
10036  private:
10042  class lexer {
10043  public:
10045  enum class token_type {
10046  uninitialized,
10047  literal_true,
10048  literal_false,
10049  literal_null,
10050  value_string,
10051  value_unsigned,
10052  value_integer,
10053  value_float,
10054  begin_array,
10055  begin_object,
10056  end_array,
10057  end_object,
10058  name_separator,
10059  value_separator,
10060  parse_error,
10061  end_of_input
10062  };
10063 
10065  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept {
10066  switch(t) {
10067  case token_type::uninitialized:
10068  return "<uninitialized>";
10069  case token_type::literal_true:
10070  return "true literal";
10071  case token_type::literal_false:
10072  return "false literal";
10073  case token_type::literal_null:
10074  return "null literal";
10075  case token_type::value_string:
10076  return "string literal";
10077  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
10078  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
10079  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
10080  return "number literal";
10081  case token_type::begin_array:
10082  return "'['";
10083  case token_type::begin_object:
10084  return "'{'";
10085  case token_type::end_array:
10086  return "']'";
10087  case token_type::end_object:
10088  return "'}'";
10089  case token_type::name_separator:
10090  return "':'";
10091  case token_type::value_separator:
10092  return "','";
10093  case token_type::parse_error:
10094  return "<parse error>";
10095  case token_type::end_of_input:
10096  return "end of input";
10097  default: {
10098  // catch non-enum values
10099  return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10100  }
10101  }
10102  }
10103 
10104  explicit lexer(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(adapter), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {
10105  }
10106 
10107  private:
10109  // locales
10111 
10113  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept {
10114  const auto loc = localeconv();
10115  assert(loc != nullptr);
10116  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : loc->decimal_point[0];
10117  }
10118 
10120  // scan functions
10122 
10129  int get_codepoint() {
10130  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
10131  assert(current == 'u');
10132  int codepoint = 0;
10133 
10134  // byte 1: \uXxxx
10135  switch(get()) {
10136  case '0':
10137  break;
10138  case '1':
10139  codepoint += 0x1000;
10140  break;
10141  case '2':
10142  codepoint += 0x2000;
10143  break;
10144  case '3':
10145  codepoint += 0x3000;
10146  break;
10147  case '4':
10148  codepoint += 0x4000;
10149  break;
10150  case '5':
10151  codepoint += 0x5000;
10152  break;
10153  case '6':
10154  codepoint += 0x6000;
10155  break;
10156  case '7':
10157  codepoint += 0x7000;
10158  break;
10159  case '8':
10160  codepoint += 0x8000;
10161  break;
10162  case '9':
10163  codepoint += 0x9000;
10164  break;
10165  case 'A':
10166  case 'a':
10167  codepoint += 0xa000;
10168  break;
10169  case 'B':
10170  case 'b':
10171  codepoint += 0xb000;
10172  break;
10173  case 'C':
10174  case 'c':
10175  codepoint += 0xc000;
10176  break;
10177  case 'D':
10178  case 'd':
10179  codepoint += 0xd000;
10180  break;
10181  case 'E':
10182  case 'e':
10183  codepoint += 0xe000;
10184  break;
10185  case 'F':
10186  case 'f':
10187  codepoint += 0xf000;
10188  break;
10189  default:
10190  return -1;
10191  }
10192 
10193  // byte 2: \uxXxx
10194  switch(get()) {
10195  case '0':
10196  break;
10197  case '1':
10198  codepoint += 0x0100;
10199  break;
10200  case '2':
10201  codepoint += 0x0200;
10202  break;
10203  case '3':
10204  codepoint += 0x0300;
10205  break;
10206  case '4':
10207  codepoint += 0x0400;
10208  break;
10209  case '5':
10210  codepoint += 0x0500;
10211  break;
10212  case '6':
10213  codepoint += 0x0600;
10214  break;
10215  case '7':
10216  codepoint += 0x0700;
10217  break;
10218  case '8':
10219  codepoint += 0x0800;
10220  break;
10221  case '9':
10222  codepoint += 0x0900;
10223  break;
10224  case 'A':
10225  case 'a':
10226  codepoint += 0x0a00;
10227  break;
10228  case 'B':
10229  case 'b':
10230  codepoint += 0x0b00;
10231  break;
10232  case 'C':
10233  case 'c':
10234  codepoint += 0x0c00;
10235  break;
10236  case 'D':
10237  case 'd':
10238  codepoint += 0x0d00;
10239  break;
10240  case 'E':
10241  case 'e':
10242  codepoint += 0x0e00;
10243  break;
10244  case 'F':
10245  case 'f':
10246  codepoint += 0x0f00;
10247  break;
10248  default:
10249  return -1;
10250  }
10251 
10252  // byte 3: \uxxXx
10253  switch(get()) {
10254  case '0':
10255  break;
10256  case '1':
10257  codepoint += 0x0010;
10258  break;
10259  case '2':
10260  codepoint += 0x0020;
10261  break;
10262  case '3':
10263  codepoint += 0x0030;
10264  break;
10265  case '4':
10266  codepoint += 0x0040;
10267  break;
10268  case '5':
10269  codepoint += 0x0050;
10270  break;
10271  case '6':
10272  codepoint += 0x0060;
10273  break;
10274  case '7':
10275  codepoint += 0x0070;
10276  break;
10277  case '8':
10278  codepoint += 0x0080;
10279  break;
10280  case '9':
10281  codepoint += 0x0090;
10282  break;
10283  case 'A':
10284  case 'a':
10285  codepoint += 0x00a0;
10286  break;
10287  case 'B':
10288  case 'b':
10289  codepoint += 0x00b0;
10290  break;
10291  case 'C':
10292  case 'c':
10293  codepoint += 0x00c0;
10294  break;
10295  case 'D':
10296  case 'd':
10297  codepoint += 0x00d0;
10298  break;
10299  case 'E':
10300  case 'e':
10301  codepoint += 0x00e0;
10302  break;
10303  case 'F':
10304  case 'f':
10305  codepoint += 0x00f0;
10306  break;
10307  default:
10308  return -1;
10309  }
10310 
10311  // byte 4: \uxxxX
10312  switch(get()) {
10313  case '0':
10314  break;
10315  case '1':
10316  codepoint += 0x0001;
10317  break;
10318  case '2':
10319  codepoint += 0x0002;
10320  break;
10321  case '3':
10322  codepoint += 0x0003;
10323  break;
10324  case '4':
10325  codepoint += 0x0004;
10326  break;
10327  case '5':
10328  codepoint += 0x0005;
10329  break;
10330  case '6':
10331  codepoint += 0x0006;
10332  break;
10333  case '7':
10334  codepoint += 0x0007;
10335  break;
10336  case '8':
10337  codepoint += 0x0008;
10338  break;
10339  case '9':
10340  codepoint += 0x0009;
10341  break;
10342  case 'A':
10343  case 'a':
10344  codepoint += 0x000a;
10345  break;
10346  case 'B':
10347  case 'b':
10348  codepoint += 0x000b;
10349  break;
10350  case 'C':
10351  case 'c':
10352  codepoint += 0x000c;
10353  break;
10354  case 'D':
10355  case 'd':
10356  codepoint += 0x000d;
10357  break;
10358  case 'E':
10359  case 'e':
10360  codepoint += 0x000e;
10361  break;
10362  case 'F':
10363  case 'f':
10364  codepoint += 0x000f;
10365  break;
10366  default:
10367  return -1;
10368  }
10369 
10370  return codepoint;
10371  }
10372 
10377  static std::string codepoint_to_string(int codepoint) {
10378  std::stringstream ss;
10379  ss << "U+" << std::setw(4) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << codepoint;
10380  return ss.str();
10381  }
10382 
10397  token_type scan_string() {
10398  // reset yytext (ignore opening quote)
10399  reset();
10400 
10401  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
10402  assert(current == '\"');
10403 
10404  while(true) {
10405  // get next character
10406  get();
10407 
10408  switch(current) {
10409  // end of file while parsing string
10410  case std::char_traits<char>::eof(): {
10411  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
10412  return token_type::parse_error;
10413  }
10414 
10415  // closing quote
10416  case '\"': {
10417  // terminate yytext
10418  add('\0');
10419  --yylen;
10420  return token_type::value_string;
10421  }
10422 
10423  // escapes
10424  case '\\': {
10425  switch(get()) {
10426  // quotation mark
10427  case '\"':
10428  add('\"');
10429  break;
10430  // reverse solidus
10431  case '\\':
10432  add('\\');
10433  break;
10434  // solidus
10435  case '/':
10436  add('/');
10437  break;
10438  // backspace
10439  case 'b':
10440  add('\b');
10441  break;
10442  // form feed
10443  case 'f':
10444  add('\f');
10445  break;
10446  // line feed
10447  case 'n':
10448  add('\n');
10449  break;
10450  // carriage return
10451  case 'r':
10452  add('\r');
10453  break;
10454  // tab
10455  case 't':
10456  add('\t');
10457  break;
10458 
10459  // unicode escapes
10460  case 'u': {
10461  int codepoint;
10462  int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
10463 
10464  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1)) {
10465  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
10466  return token_type::parse_error;
10467  }
10468 
10469  // check if code point is a high surrogate
10470  if(0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF) {
10471  // expect next \uxxxx entry
10472  if(JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u')) {
10473  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
10474 
10475  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1)) {
10476  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
10477  return token_type::parse_error;
10478  }
10479 
10480  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
10481  if(JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF)) {
10482  codepoint =
10483  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
10484  (codepoint1 << 10)
10485  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
10486  + codepoint2
10487  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
10488  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
10489  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
10490  - 0x35FDC00;
10491  }
10492  else {
10493  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " +
10494  codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) +
10495  " must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF instead of " +
10496  codepoint_to_string(codepoint2);
10497  return token_type::parse_error;
10498  }
10499  }
10500  else {
10501  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) +
10502  " must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
10503  return token_type::parse_error;
10504  }
10505  }
10506  else {
10507  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF)) {
10508  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) +
10509  " must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
10510  return token_type::parse_error;
10511  }
10512 
10513  // only work with first code point
10514  codepoint = codepoint1;
10515  }
10516 
10517  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
10518  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
10519 
10520  // translate code point to bytes
10521  if(codepoint < 0x80) {
10522  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
10523  add(codepoint);
10524  }
10525  else if(codepoint <= 0x7ff) {
10526  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
10527  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
10528  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
10529  }
10530  else if(codepoint <= 0xffff) {
10531  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
10532  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
10533  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
10534  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
10535  }
10536  else {
10537  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
10538  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
10539  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
10540  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
10541  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
10542  }
10543 
10544  break;
10545  }
10546 
10547  // other characters after escape
10548  default:
10549  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
10550  return token_type::parse_error;
10551  }
10552 
10553  break;
10554  }
10555 
10556  // invalid control characters
10557  case 0x00:
10558  case 0x01:
10559  case 0x02:
10560  case 0x03:
10561  case 0x04:
10562  case 0x05:
10563  case 0x06:
10564  case 0x07:
10565  case 0x08:
10566  case 0x09:
10567  case 0x0a:
10568  case 0x0b:
10569  case 0x0c:
10570  case 0x0d:
10571  case 0x0e:
10572  case 0x0f:
10573  case 0x10:
10574  case 0x11:
10575  case 0x12:
10576  case 0x13:
10577  case 0x14:
10578  case 0x15:
10579  case 0x16:
10580  case 0x17:
10581  case 0x18:
10582  case 0x19:
10583  case 0x1a:
10584  case 0x1b:
10585  case 0x1c:
10586  case 0x1d:
10587  case 0x1e:
10588  case 0x1f: {
10589  error_message =
10590  "invalid string: control character " + codepoint_to_string(current) + " must be escaped";
10591  return token_type::parse_error;
10592  }
10593 
10594  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
10595  case 0x20:
10596  case 0x21:
10597  case 0x23:
10598  case 0x24:
10599  case 0x25:
10600  case 0x26:
10601  case 0x27:
10602  case 0x28:
10603  case 0x29:
10604  case 0x2a:
10605  case 0x2b:
10606  case 0x2c:
10607  case 0x2d:
10608  case 0x2e:
10609  case 0x2f:
10610  case 0x30:
10611  case 0x31:
10612  case 0x32:
10613  case 0x33:
10614  case 0x34:
10615  case 0x35:
10616  case 0x36:
10617  case 0x37:
10618  case 0x38:
10619  case 0x39:
10620  case 0x3a:
10621  case 0x3b:
10622  case 0x3c:
10623  case 0x3d:
10624  case 0x3e:
10625  case 0x3f:
10626  case 0x40:
10627  case 0x41:
10628  case 0x42:
10629  case 0x43:
10630  case 0x44:
10631  case 0x45:
10632  case 0x46:
10633  case 0x47:
10634  case 0x48:
10635  case 0x49:
10636  case 0x4a:
10637  case 0x4b:
10638  case 0x4c:
10639  case 0x4d:
10640  case 0x4e:
10641  case 0x4f:
10642  case 0x50:
10643  case 0x51:
10644  case 0x52:
10645  case 0x53:
10646  case 0x54:
10647  case 0x55:
10648  case 0x56:
10649  case 0x57:
10650  case 0x58:
10651  case 0x59:
10652  case 0x5a:
10653  case 0x5b:
10654  case 0x5d:
10655  case 0x5e:
10656  case 0x5f:
10657  case 0x60:
10658  case 0x61:
10659  case 0x62:
10660  case 0x63:
10661  case 0x64:
10662  case 0x65:
10663  case 0x66:
10664  case 0x67:
10665  case 0x68:
10666  case 0x69:
10667  case 0x6a:
10668  case 0x6b:
10669  case 0x6c:
10670  case 0x6d:
10671  case 0x6e:
10672  case 0x6f:
10673  case 0x70:
10674  case 0x71:
10675  case 0x72:
10676  case 0x73:
10677  case 0x74:
10678  case 0x75:
10679  case 0x76:
10680  case 0x77:
10681  case 0x78:
10682  case 0x79:
10683  case 0x7a:
10684  case 0x7b:
10685  case 0x7c:
10686  case 0x7d:
10687  case 0x7e:
10688  case 0x7f: {
10689  add(current);
10690  break;
10691  }
10692 
10693  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
10694  case 0xc2:
10695  case 0xc3:
10696  case 0xc4:
10697  case 0xc5:
10698  case 0xc6:
10699  case 0xc7:
10700  case 0xc8:
10701  case 0xc9:
10702  case 0xca:
10703  case 0xcb:
10704  case 0xcc:
10705  case 0xcd:
10706  case 0xce:
10707  case 0xcf:
10708  case 0xd0:
10709  case 0xd1:
10710  case 0xd2:
10711  case 0xd3:
10712  case 0xd4:
10713  case 0xd5:
10714  case 0xd6:
10715  case 0xd7:
10716  case 0xd8:
10717  case 0xd9:
10718  case 0xda:
10719  case 0xdb:
10720  case 0xdc:
10721  case 0xdd:
10722  case 0xde:
10723  case 0xdf: {
10724  add(current);
10725  get();
10726  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10727  add(current);
10728  continue;
10729  }
10730 
10731  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10732  return token_type::parse_error;
10733  }
10734 
10735  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
10736  case 0xe0: {
10737  add(current);
10738  get();
10739  if(JSON_LIKELY(0xa0 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10740  add(current);
10741  get();
10742  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10743  add(current);
10744  continue;
10745  }
10746  }
10747 
10748  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10749  return token_type::parse_error;
10750  }
10751 
10752  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
10753  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
10754  case 0xe1:
10755  case 0xe2:
10756  case 0xe3:
10757  case 0xe4:
10758  case 0xe5:
10759  case 0xe6:
10760  case 0xe7:
10761  case 0xe8:
10762  case 0xe9:
10763  case 0xea:
10764  case 0xeb:
10765  case 0xec:
10766  case 0xee:
10767  case 0xef: {
10768  add(current);
10769  get();
10770  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10771  add(current);
10772  get();
10773  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10774  add(current);
10775  continue;
10776  }
10777  }
10778 
10779  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10780  return token_type::parse_error;
10781  }
10782 
10783  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
10784  case 0xed: {
10785  add(current);
10786  get();
10787  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0x9f)) {
10788  add(current);
10789  get();
10790  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10791  add(current);
10792  continue;
10793  }
10794  }
10795 
10796  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10797  return token_type::parse_error;
10798  }
10799 
10800  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
10801  case 0xf0: {
10802  add(current);
10803  get();
10804  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x90 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10805  add(current);
10806  get();
10807  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10808  add(current);
10809  get();
10810  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10811  add(current);
10812  continue;
10813  }
10814  }
10815  }
10816 
10817  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10818  return token_type::parse_error;
10819  }
10820 
10821  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
10822  case 0xf1:
10823  case 0xf2:
10824  case 0xf3: {
10825  add(current);
10826  get();
10827  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10828  add(current);
10829  get();
10830  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10831  add(current);
10832  get();
10833  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10834  add(current);
10835  continue;
10836  }
10837  }
10838  }
10839 
10840  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10841  return token_type::parse_error;
10842  }
10843 
10844  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
10845  case 0xf4: {
10846  add(current);
10847  get();
10848  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0x8f)) {
10849  add(current);
10850  get();
10851  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10852  add(current);
10853  get();
10854  if(JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf)) {
10855  add(current);
10856  continue;
10857  }
10858  }
10859  }
10860 
10861  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10862  return token_type::parse_error;
10863  }
10864 
10865  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
10866  default: {
10867  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
10868  return token_type::parse_error;
10869  }
10870  }
10871  }
10872  }
10873 
10874  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept {
10875  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
10876  }
10877 
10878  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept {
10879  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
10880  }
10881 
10882  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept {
10883  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
10884  }
10885 
10927  token_type scan_number() // lgtm [cpp/use-of-goto]
10928  {
10929  // reset yytext to store the number's bytes
10930  reset();
10931 
10932  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
10933  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
10934  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
10935 
10936  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
10937  switch(current) {
10938  case '-': {
10939  add(current);
10940  goto scan_number_minus;
10941  }
10942 
10943  case '0': {
10944  add(current);
10945  goto scan_number_zero;
10946  }
10947 
10948  case '1':
10949  case '2':
10950  case '3':
10951  case '4':
10952  case '5':
10953  case '6':
10954  case '7':
10955  case '8':
10956  case '9': {
10957  add(current);
10958  goto scan_number_any1;
10959  }
10960 
10961  default: {
10962  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
10963  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10964  }
10965  }
10966 
10967  scan_number_minus:
10968  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
10969  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
10970  switch(get()) {
10971  case '0': {
10972  add(current);
10973  goto scan_number_zero;
10974  }
10975 
10976  case '1':
10977  case '2':
10978  case '3':
10979  case '4':
10980  case '5':
10981  case '6':
10982  case '7':
10983  case '8':
10984  case '9': {
10985  add(current);
10986  goto scan_number_any1;
10987  }
10988 
10989  default: {
10990  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
10991  return token_type::parse_error;
10992  }
10993  }
10994 
10995  scan_number_zero:
10996  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
10997  switch(get()) {
10998  case '.': {
10999  add(decimal_point_char);
11000  goto scan_number_decimal1;
11001  }
11002 
11003  case 'e':
11004  case 'E': {
11005  add(current);
11006  goto scan_number_exponent;
11007  }
11008 
11009  default: {
11010  goto scan_number_done;
11011  }
11012  }
11013 
11014  scan_number_any1:
11015  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
11016  switch(get()) {
11017  case '0':
11018  case '1':
11019  case '2':
11020  case '3':
11021  case '4':
11022  case '5':
11023  case '6':
11024  case '7':
11025  case '8':
11026  case '9': {
11027  add(current);
11028  goto scan_number_any1;
11029  }
11030 
11031  case '.': {
11032  add(decimal_point_char);
11033  goto scan_number_decimal1;
11034  }
11035 
11036  case 'e':
11037  case 'E': {
11038  add(current);
11039  goto scan_number_exponent;
11040  }
11041 
11042  default: {
11043  goto scan_number_done;
11044  }
11045  }
11046 
11047  scan_number_decimal1:
11048  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
11049  number_type = token_type::value_float;
11050  switch(get()) {
11051  case '0':
11052  case '1':
11053  case '2':
11054  case '3':
11055  case '4':
11056  case '5':
11057  case '6':
11058  case '7':
11059  case '8':
11060  case '9': {
11061  add(current);
11062  goto scan_number_decimal2;
11063  }
11064 
11065  default: {
11066  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
11067  return token_type::parse_error;
11068  }
11069  }
11070 
11071  scan_number_decimal2:
11072  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
11073  switch(get()) {
11074  case '0':
11075  case '1':
11076  case '2':
11077  case '3':
11078  case '4':
11079  case '5':
11080  case '6':
11081  case '7':
11082  case '8':
11083  case '9': {
11084  add(current);
11085  goto scan_number_decimal2;
11086  }
11087 
11088  case 'e':
11089  case 'E': {
11090  add(current);
11091  goto scan_number_exponent;
11092  }
11093 
11094  default: {
11095  goto scan_number_done;
11096  }
11097  }
11098 
11099  scan_number_exponent:
11100  // we just parsed an exponent
11101  number_type = token_type::value_float;
11102  switch(get()) {
11103  case '+':
11104  case '-': {
11105  add(current);
11106  goto scan_number_sign;
11107  }
11108 
11109  case '0':
11110  case '1':
11111  case '2':
11112  case '3':
11113  case '4':
11114  case '5':
11115  case '6':
11116  case '7':
11117  case '8':
11118  case '9': {
11119  add(current);
11120  goto scan_number_any2;
11121  }
11122 
11123  default: {
11124  error_message = "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
11125  return token_type::parse_error;
11126  }
11127  }
11128 
11129  scan_number_sign:
11130  // we just parsed an exponent sign
11131  switch(get()) {
11132  case '0':
11133  case '1':
11134  case '2':
11135  case '3':
11136  case '4':
11137  case '5':
11138  case '6':
11139  case '7':
11140  case '8':
11141  case '9': {
11142  add(current);
11143  goto scan_number_any2;
11144  }
11145 
11146  default: {
11147  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
11148  return token_type::parse_error;
11149  }
11150  }
11151 
11152  scan_number_any2:
11153  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
11154  switch(get()) {
11155  case '0':
11156  case '1':
11157  case '2':
11158  case '3':
11159  case '4':
11160  case '5':
11161  case '6':
11162  case '7':
11163  case '8':
11164  case '9': {
11165  add(current);
11166  goto scan_number_any2;
11167  }
11168 
11169  default: {
11170  goto scan_number_done;
11171  }
11172  }
11173 
11174  scan_number_done:
11175  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know
11176  // that we are done scanning a number)
11177  --chars_read;
11178  next_unget = true;
11179 
11180  // terminate token
11181  add('\0');
11182  --yylen;
11183 
11184  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
11185  if(number_type == token_type::value_unsigned) {
11186  char* endptr = nullptr;
11187  errno = 0;
11188  const auto x = std::strtoull(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
11189 
11190  // we checked the number format before
11191  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
11192 
11193  if(errno == 0) {
11194  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
11195  if(value_unsigned == x) {
11196  return token_type::value_unsigned;
11197  }
11198  }
11199  }
11200  else if(number_type == token_type::value_integer) {
11201  char* endptr = nullptr;
11202  errno = 0;
11203  const auto x = std::strtoll(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
11204 
11205  // we checked the number format before
11206  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
11207 
11208  if(errno == 0) {
11209  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
11210  if(value_integer == x) {
11211  return token_type::value_integer;
11212  }
11213  }
11214  }
11215 
11216  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if
11217  // an integer conversion above failed
11218  strtof(value_float, yytext.data(), nullptr);
11219  return token_type::value_float;
11220  }
11221 
11222  token_type scan_true() {
11223  assert(current == 't');
11224  if(JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'r' and get() == 'u' and get() == 'e'))) {
11225  return token_type::literal_true;
11226  }
11227 
11228  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'true'";
11229  return token_type::parse_error;
11230  }
11231 
11232  token_type scan_false() {
11233  assert(current == 'f');
11234  if(JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'a' and get() == 'l' and get() == 's' and get() == 'e'))) {
11235  return token_type::literal_false;
11236  }
11237 
11238  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'false'";
11239  return token_type::parse_error;
11240  }
11241 
11242  token_type scan_null() {
11243  assert(current == 'n');
11244  if(JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'u' and get() == 'l' and get() == 'l'))) {
11245  return token_type::literal_null;
11246  }
11247 
11248  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'null'";
11249  return token_type::parse_error;
11250  }
11251 
11253  // input management
11255 
11257  void reset() noexcept {
11258  yylen = 0;
11259  start_pos = chars_read - 1;
11260  }
11261 
11263  int get() {
11264  ++chars_read;
11265  return next_unget ? (next_unget = false, current) : (current = ia->get_character());
11266  }
11267 
11269  void add(int c) {
11270  // resize yytext if necessary; this condition is deemed unlikely,
11271  // because we start with a 1024-byte buffer
11272  if(JSON_UNLIKELY((yylen + 1 > yytext.capacity()))) {
11273  yytext.resize(2 * yytext.capacity(), '\0');
11274  }
11275  yytext[yylen++] = static_cast<char>(c);
11276  }
11277 
11278  public:
11280  // value getters
11282 
11284  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept {
11285  return value_integer;
11286  }
11287 
11289  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept {
11290  return value_unsigned;
11291  }
11292 
11294  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept {
11295  return value_float;
11296  }
11297 
11299  const std::string get_string() {
11300  // yytext cannot be returned as char*, because it may contain a
11301  // null byte (parsed as "\u0000")
11302  return std::string(yytext.data(), yylen);
11303  }
11304 
11306  // diagnostics
11308 
11310  constexpr size_t get_position() const noexcept {
11311  return chars_read;
11312  }
11313 
11315  std::string get_token_string() const {
11316  // get the raw byte sequence of the last token
11317  std::string s = ia->read(start_pos, chars_read - start_pos);
11318 
11319  // escape control characters
11320  std::string result;
11321  for(auto c : s) {
11322  if(c == '\0' or c == std::char_traits<char>::eof()) {
11323  // ignore EOF
11324  continue;
11325  }
11326  else if('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1f') {
11327  // escape control characters
11328  result += "<" + codepoint_to_string(c) + ">";
11329  }
11330  else {
11331  // add character as is
11332  result.append(1, c);
11333  }
11334  }
11335 
11336  return result;
11337  }
11338 
11340  const std::string& get_error_message() const noexcept {
11341  return error_message;
11342  }
11343 
11345  // actual scanner
11347 
11348  token_type scan() {
11349  // read next character and ignore whitespace
11350  do {
11351  get();
11352  } while(current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
11353 
11354  switch(current) {
11355  // structural characters
11356  case '[':
11357  return token_type::begin_array;
11358  case ']':
11359  return token_type::end_array;
11360  case '{':
11361  return token_type::begin_object;
11362  case '}':
11363  return token_type::end_object;
11364  case ':':
11365  return token_type::name_separator;
11366  case ',':
11367  return token_type::value_separator;
11368 
11369  // literals
11370  case 't':
11371  return scan_true();
11372  case 'f':
11373  return scan_false();
11374  case 'n':
11375  return scan_null();
11376 
11377  // string
11378  case '\"':
11379  return scan_string();
11380 
11381  // number
11382  case '-':
11383  case '0':
11384  case '1':
11385  case '2':
11386  case '3':
11387  case '4':
11388  case '5':
11389  case '6':
11390  case '7':
11391  case '8':
11392  case '9':
11393  return scan_number();
11394 
11395  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
11396  // string literals)
11397  case '\0':
11398  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
11399  return token_type::end_of_input;
11400 
11401  // error
11402  default:
11403  error_message = "invalid literal";
11404  return token_type::parse_error;
11405  }
11406  }
11407 
11408  private:
11410  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
11411 
11413  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
11414 
11416  bool next_unget = false;
11417 
11419  size_t chars_read = 0;
11421  size_t start_pos = 0;
11422 
11424  std::vector<char> yytext = std::vector<char>(1024, '\0');
11426  size_t yylen = 0;
11427 
11429  std::string error_message = "";
11430 
11431  // number values
11432  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
11433  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
11434  number_float_t value_float = 0;
11435 
11437  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
11438  };
11439 
11445  class parser {
11446  public:
11448  explicit parser(input_adapter_t adapter, const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
11449  : callback(cb), m_lexer(adapter) {
11450  }
11451 
11462  basic_json parse(const bool strict = true) {
11463  // read first token
11464  get_token();
11465 
11466  basic_json result = parse_internal(true);
11467  result.assert_invariant();
11468 
11469  if(strict) {
11470  get_token();
11471  expect(lexer::token_type::end_of_input);
11472  }
11473 
11474  // return parser result and replace it with null in case the
11475  // top-level value was discarded by the callback function
11476  return result.is_discarded() ? basic_json() : std::move(result);
11477  }
11478 
11485  bool accept(const bool strict = true) {
11486  // read first token
11487  get_token();
11488 
11489  if(not accept_internal()) {
11490  return false;
11491  }
11492 
11493  if(strict and get_token() != lexer::token_type::end_of_input) {
11494  return false;
11495  }
11496 
11497  return true;
11498  }
11499 
11500  private:
11507  basic_json parse_internal(bool keep) {
11508  auto result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11509 
11510  switch(last_token) {
11511  case lexer::token_type::begin_object: {
11512  if(keep and
11513  (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start, result)) != 0))) {
11514  // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
11515  result.m_type = value_t::object;
11516  result.m_value = value_t::object;
11517  }
11518 
11519  // read next token
11520  get_token();
11521 
11522  // closing } -> we are done
11523  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object) {
11524  if(keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result)) {
11525  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11526  }
11527  return result;
11528  }
11529 
11530  // parse values
11531  while(true) {
11532  // store key
11533  expect(lexer::token_type::value_string);
11534  const auto key = m_lexer.get_string();
11535 
11536  bool keep_tag = false;
11537  if(keep) {
11538  if(callback) {
11539  basic_json k(key);
11540  keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
11541  }
11542  else {
11543  keep_tag = true;
11544  }
11545  }
11546 
11547  // parse separator (:)
11548  get_token();
11549  expect(lexer::token_type::name_separator);
11550 
11551  // parse and add value
11552  get_token();
11553  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
11554  if(keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded()) {
11555  result[key] = std::move(value);
11556  }
11557 
11558  // comma -> next value
11559  get_token();
11560  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator) {
11561  get_token();
11562  continue;
11563  }
11564 
11565  // closing }
11566  expect(lexer::token_type::end_object);
11567  break;
11568  }
11569 
11570  if(keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result)) {
11571  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11572  }
11573 
11574  return result;
11575  }
11576 
11577  case lexer::token_type::begin_array: {
11578  if(keep and
11579  (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start, result)) != 0))) {
11580  // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
11581  result.m_type = value_t::array;
11582  result.m_value = value_t::array;
11583  }
11584 
11585  // read next token
11586  get_token();
11587 
11588  // closing ] -> we are done
11589  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array) {
11590  if(callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result)) {
11591  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11592  }
11593  return result;
11594  }
11595 
11596  // parse values
11597  while(true) {
11598  // parse value
11599  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
11600  if(keep and not value.is_discarded()) {
11601  result.push_back(std::move(value));
11602  }
11603 
11604  // comma -> next value
11605  get_token();
11606  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator) {
11607  get_token();
11608  continue;
11609  }
11610 
11611  // closing ]
11612  expect(lexer::token_type::end_array);
11613  break;
11614  }
11615 
11616  if(keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result)) {
11617  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11618  }
11619 
11620  return result;
11621  }
11622 
11623  case lexer::token_type::literal_null: {
11624  result.m_type = value_t::null;
11625  break;
11626  }
11627 
11628  case lexer::token_type::value_string: {
11629  result = basic_json(m_lexer.get_string());
11630  break;
11631  }
11632 
11633  case lexer::token_type::literal_true: {
11634  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
11635  result.m_value = true;
11636  break;
11637  }
11638 
11639  case lexer::token_type::literal_false: {
11640  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
11641  result.m_value = false;
11642  break;
11643  }
11644 
11645  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned: {
11646  result.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
11647  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_unsigned();
11648  break;
11649  }
11650 
11651  case lexer::token_type::value_integer: {
11652  result.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
11653  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_integer();
11654  break;
11655  }
11656 
11657  case lexer::token_type::value_float: {
11658  result.m_type = value_t::number_float;
11659  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_float();
11660 
11661  // throw in case of infinity or NAN
11662  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(result.m_value.number_float))) {
11663  JSON_THROW(
11664  out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
11665  }
11666 
11667  break;
11668  }
11669 
11670  default: {
11671  // the last token was unexpected
11672  unexpect(last_token);
11673  }
11674  }
11675 
11676  if(keep and callback and not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result)) {
11677  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
11678  }
11679  return result;
11680  }
11681 
11693  bool accept_internal() {
11694  switch(last_token) {
11695  case lexer::token_type::begin_object: {
11696  // read next token
11697  get_token();
11698 
11699  // closing } -> we are done
11700  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object) {
11701  return true;
11702  }
11703 
11704  // parse values
11705  while(true) {
11706  // parse key
11707  if(last_token != lexer::token_type::value_string) {
11708  return false;
11709  }
11710 
11711  // parse separator (:)
11712  get_token();
11713  if(last_token != lexer::token_type::name_separator) {
11714  return false;
11715  }
11716 
11717  // parse value
11718  get_token();
11719  if(not accept_internal()) {
11720  return false;
11721  }
11722 
11723  // comma -> next value
11724  get_token();
11725  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator) {
11726  get_token();
11727  continue;
11728  }
11729 
11730  // closing }
11731  if(last_token != lexer::token_type::end_object) {
11732  return false;
11733  }
11734 
11735  return true;
11736  }
11737  }
11738 
11739  case lexer::token_type::begin_array: {
11740  // read next token
11741  get_token();
11742 
11743  // closing ] -> we are done
11744  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array) {
11745  return true;
11746  }
11747 
11748  // parse values
11749  while(true) {
11750  // parse value
11751  if(not accept_internal()) {
11752  return false;
11753  }
11754 
11755  // comma -> next value
11756  get_token();
11757  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator) {
11758  get_token();
11759  continue;
11760  }
11761 
11762  // closing ]
11763  if(last_token != lexer::token_type::end_array) {
11764  return false;
11765  }
11766 
11767  return true;
11768  }
11769  }
11770 
11771  case lexer::token_type::literal_false:
11772  case lexer::token_type::literal_null:
11773  case lexer::token_type::literal_true:
11774  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
11775  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
11776  case lexer::token_type::value_string:
11777  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned: {
11778  return true;
11779  }
11780 
11781  default: {
11782  // the last token was unexpected
11783  return false;
11784  }
11785  }
11786  }
11787 
11789  typename lexer::token_type get_token() {
11790  last_token = m_lexer.scan();
11791  return last_token;
11792  }
11793 
11797  void expect(typename lexer::token_type t) const {
11798  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(t != last_token)) {
11799  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
11800  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error) {
11801  error_msg += m_lexer.get_error_message() + "; last read: '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
11802  }
11803  else {
11804  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
11805  }
11806 
11807  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(t));
11808  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
11809  }
11810  }
11811 
11815  void unexpect(typename lexer::token_type t) const {
11816  if(JSON_UNLIKELY(t == last_token)) {
11817  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
11818  if(last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error) {
11819  error_msg += m_lexer.get_error_message() + "; last read '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
11820  }
11821  else {
11822  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
11823  }
11824 
11825  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
11826  }
11827  }
11828 
11829  private:
11831  int depth = 0;
11833  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
11835  typename lexer::token_type last_token = lexer::token_type::uninitialized;
11837  lexer m_lexer;
11838  };
11839 
11840  public:
11852  class json_pointer {
11854  friend class basic_json;
11855 
11856  public:
11879  explicit json_pointer(const std::string& s = "") : reference_tokens(split(s)) {
11880  }
11881 
11897  std::string to_string() const noexcept {
11898  return std::accumulate(reference_tokens.begin(), reference_tokens.end(), std::string{},
11899  [](const std::string& a, const std::string& b) { return a + "/" + escape(b); });
11900  }
11901 
11903  operator std::string() const {
11904  return to_string();
11905  }
11906 
11907  private:
11912  std::string pop_back() {
11913  if(is_root()) {
11914  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
11915  }
11916 
11917  auto last = reference_tokens.back();
11918  reference_tokens.pop_back();
11919  return last;
11920  }
11921 
11923  bool is_root() const {
11924  return reference_tokens.empty();
11925  }
11926 
11927  json_pointer top() const {
11928  if(is_root()) {
11929  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
11930  }
11931 
11932  json_pointer result = *this;
11933  result.reference_tokens = {reference_tokens[0]};
11934  return result;
11935  }
11936 
11945  reference get_and_create(reference j) const {
11946  pointer result = &j;
11947 
11948  // in case no reference tokens exist, return a reference to the
11949  // JSON value j which will be overwritten by a primitive value
11950  for(const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens) {
11951  switch(result->m_type) {
11952  case value_t::null: {
11953  if(reference_token == "0") {
11954  // start a new array if reference token is 0
11955  result = &result->operator[](0);
11956  }
11957  else {
11958  // start a new object otherwise
11959  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
11960  }
11961  break;
11962  }
11963 
11964  case value_t::object: {
11965  // create an entry in the object
11966  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
11967  break;
11968  }
11969 
11970  case value_t::array: {
11971  // create an entry in the array
11972  JSON_TRY {
11973  result = &result->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
11974  }
11975  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&) {
11976  JSON_THROW(
11977  parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
11978  }
11979  break;
11980  }
11981 
11982  /*
11983  The following code is only reached if there exists a
11984  reference token _and_ the current value is primitive. In
11985  this case, we have an error situation, because primitive
11986  values may only occur as single value; that is, with an
11987  empty list of reference tokens.
11988  */
11989  default: {
11990  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(313, "invalid value to unflatten"));
11991  }
11992  }
11993  }
11994 
11995  return *result;
11996  }
11997 
12017  reference get_unchecked(pointer ptr) const {
12018  for(const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens) {
12019  // convert null values to arrays or objects before continuing
12020  if(ptr->m_type == value_t::null) {
12021  // check if reference token is a number
12022  const bool nums = std::all_of(reference_token.begin(), reference_token.end(),
12023  [](const char x) { return (x >= '0' and x <= '9'); });
12024 
12025  // change value to array for numbers or "-" or to object
12026  // otherwise
12027  if(nums or reference_token == "-") {
12028  *ptr = value_t::array;
12029  }
12030  else {
12031  *ptr = value_t::object;
12032  }
12033  }
12034 
12035  switch(ptr->m_type) {
12036  case value_t::object: {
12037  // use unchecked object access
12038  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
12039  break;
12040  }
12041 
12042  case value_t::array: {
12043  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
12044  if(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0') {
12045  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12046  106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
12047  }
12048 
12049  if(reference_token == "-") {
12050  // explicitly treat "-" as index beyond the end
12051  ptr = &ptr->operator[](ptr->m_value.array->size());
12052  }
12053  else {
12054  // convert array index to number; unchecked access
12055  JSON_TRY {
12056  ptr = &ptr->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
12057  }
12058  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&) {
12059  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12060  109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
12061  }
12062  }
12063  break;
12064  }
12065 
12066  default: {
12067  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
12068  }
12069  }
12070  }
12071 
12072  return *ptr;
12073  }
12074 
12081  reference get_checked(pointer ptr) const {
12082  for(const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens) {
12083  switch(ptr->m_type) {
12084  case value_t::object: {
12085  // note: at performs range check
12086  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
12087  break;
12088  }
12089 
12090  case value_t::array: {
12091  if(reference_token == "-") {
12092  // "-" always fails the range check
12093  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
12094  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
12095  ") is out of range"));
12096  }
12097 
12098  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
12099  if(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0') {
12100  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12101  106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
12102  }
12103 
12104  // note: at performs range check
12105  JSON_TRY {
12106  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
12107  }
12108  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&) {
12109  JSON_THROW(
12110  parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
12111  }
12112  break;
12113  }
12114 
12115  default: {
12116  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
12117  }
12118  }
12119  }
12120 
12121  return *ptr;
12122  }
12123 
12137  const_reference get_unchecked(const_pointer ptr) const {
12138  for(const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens) {
12139  switch(ptr->m_type) {
12140  case value_t::object: {
12141  // use unchecked object access
12142  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
12143  break;
12144  }
12145 
12146  case value_t::array: {
12147  if(reference_token == "-") {
12148  // "-" cannot be used for const access
12149  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
12150  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
12151  ") is out of range"));
12152  }
12153 
12154  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
12155  if(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0') {
12156  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12157  106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
12158  }
12159 
12160  // use unchecked array access
12161  JSON_TRY {
12162  ptr = &ptr->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
12163  }
12164  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&) {
12165  JSON_THROW(
12166  parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
12167  }
12168  break;
12169  }
12170 
12171  default: {
12172  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
12173  }
12174  }
12175  }
12176 
12177  return *ptr;
12178  }
12179 
12186  const_reference get_checked(const_pointer ptr) const {
12187  for(const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens) {
12188  switch(ptr->m_type) {
12189  case value_t::object: {
12190  // note: at performs range check
12191  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
12192  break;
12193  }
12194 
12195  case value_t::array: {
12196  if(reference_token == "-") {
12197  // "-" always fails the range check
12198  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
12199  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
12200  ") is out of range"));
12201  }
12202 
12203  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
12204  if(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0') {
12205  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12206  106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
12207  }
12208 
12209  // note: at performs range check
12210  JSON_TRY {
12211  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
12212  }
12213  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&) {
12214  JSON_THROW(
12215  parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
12216  }
12217  break;
12218  }
12219 
12220  default: {
12221  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
12222  }
12223  }
12224  }
12225 
12226  return *ptr;
12227  }
12228 
12238  static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& reference_string) {
12239  std::vector<std::string> result;
12240 
12241  // special case: empty reference string -> no reference tokens
12242  if(reference_string.empty()) {
12243  return result;
12244  }
12245 
12246  // check if nonempty reference string begins with slash
12247  if(reference_string[0] != '/') {
12248  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(
12249  107, 1, "JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/' - was: '" + reference_string + "'"));
12250  }
12251 
12252  // extract the reference tokens:
12253  // - slash: position of the last read slash (or end of string)
12254  // - start: position after the previous slash
12255  for(
12256  // search for the first slash after the first character
12257  size_t slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', 1),
12258  // set the beginning of the first reference token
12259  start = 1;
12260  // we can stop if start == string::npos+1 = 0
12261  start != 0;
12262  // set the beginning of the next reference token
12263  // (will eventually be 0 if slash == std::string::npos)
12264  start = slash + 1,
12265  // find next slash
12266  slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', start)) {
12267  // use the text between the beginning of the reference token
12268  // (start) and the last slash (slash).
12269  auto reference_token = reference_string.substr(start, slash - start);
12270 
12271  // check reference tokens are properly escaped
12272  for(size_t pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~'); pos != std::string::npos;
12273  pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~', pos + 1)) {
12274  assert(reference_token[pos] == '~');
12275 
12276  // ~ must be followed by 0 or 1
12277  if(pos == reference_token.size() - 1 or
12278  (reference_token[pos + 1] != '0' and reference_token[pos + 1] != '1')) {
12279  JSON_THROW(
12280  parse_error::create(108, 0, "escape character '~' must be followed with '0' or '1'"));
12281  }
12282  }
12283 
12284  // finally, store the reference token
12285  unescape(reference_token);
12286  result.push_back(reference_token);
12287  }
12288 
12289  return result;
12290  }
12291 
12305  static void replace_substring(std::string& s, const std::string& f, const std::string& t) {
12306  assert(not f.empty());
12307 
12308  for(size_t pos = s.find(f); // find first occurrence of f
12309  pos != std::string::npos; // make sure f was found
12310  s.replace(pos, f.size(), t), // replace with t
12311  pos = s.find(f, pos + t.size()) // find next occurrence of f
12312  )
12313  ;
12314  }
12315 
12317  static std::string escape(std::string s) {
12318  // escape "~"" to "~0" and "/" to "~1"
12319  replace_substring(s, "~", "~0");
12320  replace_substring(s, "/", "~1");
12321  return s;
12322  }
12323 
12325  static void unescape(std::string& s) {
12326  // first transform any occurrence of the sequence '~1' to '/'
12327  replace_substring(s, "~1", "/");
12328  // then transform any occurrence of the sequence '~0' to '~'
12329  replace_substring(s, "~0", "~");
12330  }
12331 
12339  static void flatten(const std::string& reference_string, const basic_json& value, basic_json& result) {
12340  switch(value.m_type) {
12341  case value_t::array: {
12342  if(value.m_value.array->empty()) {
12343  // flatten empty array as null
12344  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
12345  }
12346  else {
12347  // iterate array and use index as reference string
12348  for(size_t i = 0; i < value.m_value.array->size(); ++i) {
12349  flatten(reference_string + "/" + std::to_string(i), value.m_value.array->operator[](i),
12350  result);
12351  }
12352  }
12353  break;
12354  }
12355 
12356  case value_t::object: {
12357  if(value.m_value.object->empty()) {
12358  // flatten empty object as null
12359  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
12360  }
12361  else {
12362  // iterate object and use keys as reference string
12363  for(const auto& element : *value.m_value.object) {
12364  flatten(reference_string + "/" + escape(element.first), element.second, result);
12365  }
12366  }
12367  break;
12368  }
12369 
12370  default: {
12371  // add primitive value with its reference string
12372  result[reference_string] = value;
12373  break;
12374  }
12375  }
12376  }
12377 
12388  static basic_json unflatten(const basic_json& value) {
12389  if(not value.is_object()) {
12390  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(314, "only objects can be unflattened"));
12391  }
12392 
12393  basic_json result;
12394 
12395  // iterate the JSON object values
12396  for(const auto& element : *value.m_value.object) {
12397  if(not element.second.is_primitive()) {
12398  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(315, "values in object must be primitive"));
12399  }
12400 
12401  // assign value to reference pointed to by JSON pointer; Note
12402  // that if the JSON pointer is "" (i.e., points to the whole
12403  // value), function get_and_create returns a reference to
12404  // result itself. An assignment will then create a primitive
12405  // value.
12406  json_pointer(element.first).get_and_create(result) = element.second;
12407  }
12408 
12409  return result;
12410  }
12411 
12412  friend bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept {
12413  return lhs.reference_tokens == rhs.reference_tokens;
12414  }
12415 
12416  friend bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept {
12417  return !(lhs == rhs);
12418  }
12419 
12421  std::vector<std::string> reference_tokens{};
12422  };
12423 
12425  // JSON Pointer support //
12427 
12430 
12464  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) {
12465  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
12466  }
12467 
12491  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const {
12492  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
12493  }
12494 
12530  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) {
12531  return ptr.get_checked(this);
12532  }
12533 
12569  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const {
12570  return ptr.get_checked(this);
12571  }
12572 
12595  basic_json flatten() const {
12596  basic_json result(value_t::object);
12597  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
12598  return result;
12599  }
12600 
12631  basic_json unflatten() const {
12632  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
12633  }
12634 
12636 
12638  // JSON Patch functions //
12640 
12643 
12691  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const {
12692  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
12693  basic_json result = *this;
12694 
12695  // the valid JSON Patch operations
12696  enum class patch_operations { add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid };
12697 
12698  const auto get_op = [](const std::string& op) {
12699  if(op == "add") {
12700  return patch_operations::add;
12701  }
12702  if(op == "remove") {
12703  return patch_operations::remove;
12704  }
12705  if(op == "replace") {
12706  return patch_operations::replace;
12707  }
12708  if(op == "move") {
12709  return patch_operations::move;
12710  }
12711  if(op == "copy") {
12712  return patch_operations::copy;
12713  }
12714  if(op == "test") {
12715  return patch_operations::test;
12716  }
12717 
12718  return patch_operations::invalid;
12719  };
12720 
12721  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
12722  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer& ptr, basic_json val) {
12723  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
12724  if(ptr.is_root()) {
12725  result = val;
12726  }
12727  else {
12728  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
12729  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
12730  if(top_pointer != ptr) {
12731  result.at(top_pointer);
12732  }
12733 
12734  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
12735  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
12736  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
12737 
12738  switch(parent.m_type) {
12739  case value_t::null:
12740  case value_t::object: {
12741  // use operator[] to add value
12742  parent[last_path] = val;
12743  break;
12744  }
12745 
12746  case value_t::array: {
12747  if(last_path == "-") {
12748  // special case: append to back
12749  parent.push_back(val);
12750  }
12751  else {
12752  const auto idx = std::stoi(last_path);
12753  if(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()) {
12754  // avoid undefined behavior
12755  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(
12756  401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
12757  }
12758  else {
12759  // default case: insert add offset
12760  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
12761  }
12762  }
12763  break;
12764  }
12765 
12766  default: {
12767  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
12768  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
12769  }
12770  }
12771  }
12772  };
12773 
12774  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
12775  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer& ptr) {
12776  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
12777  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
12778  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
12779 
12780  // remove child
12781  if(parent.is_object()) {
12782  // perform range check
12783  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
12784  if(it != parent.end()) {
12785  parent.erase(it);
12786  }
12787  else {
12788  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
12789  }
12790  }
12791  else if(parent.is_array()) {
12792  // note erase performs range check
12793  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(last_path)));
12794  }
12795  };
12796 
12797  // type check: top level value must be an array
12798  if(not json_patch.is_array()) {
12799  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
12800  }
12801 
12802  // iterate and apply the operations
12803  for(const auto& val : json_patch) {
12804  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
12805  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string& op, const std::string& member,
12806  bool string_type) -> basic_json& {
12807  // find value
12808  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
12809 
12810  // context-sensitive error message
12811  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
12812 
12813  // check if desired value is present
12814  if(it == val.m_value.object->end()) {
12815  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
12816  }
12817 
12818  // check if result is of type string
12819  if(string_type and not it->second.is_string()) {
12820  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
12821  }
12822 
12823  // no error: return value
12824  return it->second;
12825  };
12826 
12827  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
12828  if(not val.is_object()) {
12829  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
12830  }
12831 
12832  // collect mandatory members
12833  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
12834  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
12835  json_pointer ptr(path);
12836 
12837  switch(get_op(op)) {
12838  case patch_operations::add: {
12839  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
12840  break;
12841  }
12842 
12843  case patch_operations::remove: {
12844  operation_remove(ptr);
12845  break;
12846  }
12847 
12848  case patch_operations::replace: {
12849  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
12850  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
12851  break;
12852  }
12853 
12854  case patch_operations::move: {
12855  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
12856  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
12857 
12858  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
12859  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
12860 
12861  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
12862  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
12863  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
12864  // location with the value that was just removed.
12865  operation_remove(from_ptr);
12866  operation_add(ptr, v);
12867  break;
12868  }
12869 
12870  case patch_operations::copy: {
12871  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
12872  ;
12873  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
12874 
12875  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
12876  result[ptr] = result.at(from_ptr);
12877  break;
12878  }
12879 
12880  case patch_operations::test: {
12881  bool success = false;
12882  JSON_TRY {
12883  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
12884  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
12885  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
12886  }
12887  JSON_CATCH(out_of_range&) {
12888  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
12889  }
12890 
12891  // throw an exception if test fails
12892  if(not success) {
12893  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
12894  }
12895 
12896  break;
12897  }
12898 
12899  case patch_operations::invalid: {
12900  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
12901  // "test"
12902  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
12903  }
12904  }
12905  }
12906 
12907  return result;
12908  }
12909 
12942  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target, const std::string& path = "") {
12943  // the patch
12944  basic_json result(value_t::array);
12945 
12946  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
12947  if(source == target) {
12948  return result;
12949  }
12950 
12951  if(source.type() != target.type()) {
12952  // different types: replace value
12953  result.push_back({{"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}});
12954  }
12955  else {
12956  switch(source.type()) {
12957  case value_t::array: {
12958  // first pass: traverse common elements
12959  size_t i = 0;
12960  while(i < source.size() and i < target.size()) {
12961  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
12962  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
12963  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
12964  ++i;
12965  }
12966 
12967  // i now reached the end of at least one array
12968  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
12969 
12970  // remove my remaining elements
12971  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
12972  while(i < source.size()) {
12973  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
12974  // indices
12975  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index,
12976  object({{"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}}));
12977  ++i;
12978  }
12979 
12980  // add other remaining elements
12981  while(i < target.size()) {
12982  result.push_back(
12983  {{"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}, {"value", target[i]}});
12984  ++i;
12985  }
12986 
12987  break;
12988  }
12989 
12990  case value_t::object: {
12991  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
12992  for(auto it = source.begin(); it != source.end(); ++it) {
12993  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
12994  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
12995 
12996  if(target.find(it.key()) != target.end()) {
12997  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
12998  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
12999  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
13000  }
13001  else {
13002  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
13003  result.push_back(object({{"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}}));
13004  }
13005  }
13006 
13007  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
13008  for(auto it = target.begin(); it != target.end(); ++it) {
13009  if(source.find(it.key()) == source.end()) {
13010  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
13011  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
13012  result.push_back({{"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}, {"value", it.value()}});
13013  }
13014  }
13015 
13016  break;
13017  }
13018 
13019  default: {
13020  // both primitive type: replace value
13021  result.push_back({{"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}});
13022  break;
13023  }
13024  }
13025  }
13026 
13027  return result;
13028  }
13029 
13031 };
13032 
13034 // presets //
13036 
13045 using json = basic_json<>;
13046 
13047 } // namespace io
13048 
13049 } // namespace possumwood
13050 
13052 // nonmember support //
13054 
13055 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
13056 namespace std {
13062 template <>
13063 inline void swap(::possumwood::io::json& j1,
13064  ::possumwood::io::json& j2) noexcept(is_nothrow_move_constructible<::possumwood::io::json>::value and
13065  is_nothrow_move_assignable<::possumwood::io::json>::value) {
13066  j1.swap(j2);
13067 }
13068 
13070 template <>
13071 struct hash<::possumwood::io::json> {
13077  std::size_t operator()(const ::possumwood::io::json& j) const {
13078  // a naive hashing via the string representation
13079  const auto& h = hash<::possumwood::io::json::string_t>();
13080  return h(j.dump());
13081  }
13082 };
13083 
13085 template <>
13086 struct less<::possumwood::io::detail::value_t> {
13091  bool operator()(::possumwood::io::detail::value_t lhs, ::possumwood::io::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept {
13092  return ::possumwood::io::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
13093  }
13094 };
13095 
13096 } // namespace std
13097 
13111 inline ::possumwood::io::json operator"" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n) {
13112  return ::possumwood::io::json::parse(s, s + n);
13113 }
13114 
13128 inline ::possumwood::io::json::json_pointer operator"" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n) {
13129  return ::possumwood::io::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
13130 }
13131 
13132 // restore GCC/clang diagnostic settings
13133 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
13134 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
13135 #endif
13136 #if defined(__clang__)
13137 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
13138 #endif
13139 
13140 // clean up
13141 #undef JSON_CATCH
13142 #undef JSON_THROW
13143 #undef JSON_TRY
13144 #undef JSON_LIKELY
